The nutritional content can vary significantly depending on the specific variety. It's essential to check the nutrition label for sugar and fiber content.

Cereal,ready to eat,kashi.description: Kashi cereal is a brand of breakfast cereal that often focuses on whole grains and plant-based ingredients. They offer a range of flavors and varieties, including some that are high in fiber and protein. It's essential to check the nutrition label for specific nutritional information.

Cereal,ready to eat,morning crisp.description: Morning crisp cereal typically refers to cereals with a crunchy texture, often containing clusters or flakes. The specific ingredients and nutritional content can vary widely depending on the brand and variety.

Cereal,ready to eat,muesli.description: Muesli is a breakfast cereal that typically contains a mix of rolled oats, nuts, seeds, and dried fruits. It's a good source of fiber, protein, and healthy fats. Muesli can be eaten cold with milk, yogurt, or enjoyed as a topping.

Cereal,ready to eat,shredded wheat.description: Shredded wheat cereal is made from whole wheat that has been shredded and formed into biscuits. It's a good source of fiber and provides a variety of nutrients. Shredded wheat has a mild flavor and can be eaten with milk, yogurt, or topped with fruits.

Cereal,ready to eat,selects.description: Selects cereal typically refers to a line of breakfast cereals that offer a variety of flavors and grain combinations. The specific ingredients and nutritional content can vary depending on the brand and variety.

Turkey,tom,drumstick.description: Turkey drumsticks are a good source of protein and lower in fat compared to darker meat cuts like thighs. They're often roasted or baked and can be seasoned with various herbs and spices.

Turkey,tom,thigh.description: Turkey thighs are a flavorful and juicy cut of meat that's higher in fat compared to turkey breast. They're a good source of protein, iron, and B vitamins. Turkey thighs can be roasted, grilled, or braised.

Cereal,ready to eat,honest o's.description: Honest O's cereal is a brand of breakfast cereal that typically contains whole grains and reduced sugar compared to some other cereals. It's essential to check the nutrition label for specific nutritional information.

Goose,wild.description: Wild goose is a lean and flavorful game meat that's higher in protein and lower in fat compared to domesticated goose. It has a slightly gamey flavor and is often roasted or grilled.

Veal,milk-fed.description: Milk-fed veal is a tender and delicate meat that comes from young calves that are primarily fed milk. It has a pale color and mild flavor. Veal is a good source of protein, iron, and B vitamins.

Cereal,hot,red river.description: Red River cereal is a brand of breakfast cereal that often features whole grains and unique flavor combinations. The specific ingredients and nutritional content can vary depending on the variety.

Plant-based beverage,soy.description: Soy milk is a plant-based milk alternative made from soybeans. It's a good source of protein, calcium, and often fortified with vitamins and minerals. Soy milk has a mild flavor and can be used in place of cow's milk in many recipes.

Soup,cream,asparagus.description: Cream of asparagus soup is a rich and creamy soup made with asparagus, broth, and cream or milk. It can be high in calories and fat, so moderation is key. It's a good source of vitamins and minerals from the asparagus.

Soup,cream,celery.description: Cream of celery soup is a classic soup made with celery, broth, and cream or milk. It's often used as a base for casseroles and other dishes. It can be high in sodium and fat, so moderation is key.

Abiyuch.description: Abiyuch is a traditional Ethiopian cheese made from skim milk. It has a crumbly texture and a slightly sour flavor. Abiyuch is often crumbled over dishes or used in salads.

Rowal.description: Rowal is a traditional fermented milk drink that is popular in parts of Africa and Asia. It is made by fermenting milk with specific bacteria, which gives it a tart flavor and thick, yogurt-like consistency. Rowal is a good source of probiotics, which are beneficial for gut health.

Potato,russet.description: Russet potatoes are versatile potatoes with a starchy texture. They're ideal for baking, mashing, and frying. Russet potatoes are a good source of carbohydrates and fiber.

Potato,white.description: White potatoes have a smooth, thin skin and a creamy texture. They're versatile for cooking and can be boiled, mashed, roasted, or fried.

Potato,red.description: Red potatoes have a thin skin and a waxy texture. They hold their shape well during cooking, making them ideal for salads, soups, and stews. Red potatoes are a good source of antioxidants.

Juice drink,mixed vegetable and fruit.description: Mixed vegetable and fruit juice drinks can be a convenient way to increase fruit and vegetable intake. However, it's essential to choose varieties that are lower in sugar and made with whole fruits and vegetables. Look for options without added sweeteners or artificial ingredients.

Tea,instant,unsweetened.description: Unsweetened instant tea is a convenient beverage option that's low in calories and sugar. It's essential to choose varieties without added flavors or sweeteners. Instant tea can be a source of antioxidants.

Tea,instant,sweetened,lemon flavour.description: Sweetened lemon-flavored instant tea is a convenient beverage option but often high in sugar. It's essential to consume it in moderation or choose unsweetened alternatives.

Sports drink,fruit flavour,low calorie.description: Low-calorie sports drinks are designed to replenish electrolytes lost during strenuous exercise. However, they often contain artificial sweeteners and flavors. It's essential to consume them in moderation or opt for water or natural electrolyte-rich beverages.

Carbonated drinks,chocolate.description: Chocolate-flavored carbonated drinks are typically high in sugar and calories. They often contain artificial sweeteners, colors, and flavors. It's best to consume them in moderation or opt for healthier beverage choices.

Wine,non-alcoholic.description: Non-alcoholic wine is made from grapes but undergoes a process to remove the alcohol content. It offers a similar flavor profile to regular wine but without the intoxicating effects. Non-alcoholic wine may contain trace amounts of alcohol.

Cream,sour,light.description: Light sour cream is a lower-fat alternative to regular sour cream. It's often made with milk, cream, and thickeners. It's important to check the label for specific fat and calorie content.

Cream,sour,fat free.description: Fat-free sour cream is a low-fat alternative to regular sour cream. It's often made with skim milk, thickeners, and stabilizers. While it's lower in fat, it may have a different texture and flavor compared to regular sour cream.

Salad dressing,french,fat free.description: Fat-free French dressing is a lower-calorie alternative to regular French dressing. It's often made with vinegar, water, herbs, spices, and thickeners. It's important to check the label for sugar and sodium content.

Butter,light.description: Light butter is a lower-fat alternative to regular butter. It's often blended with water, oils, or other ingredients to reduce the fat content. It's important to check the label for specific fat and calorie content.

Meat drippings.description: Meat drippings are the flavorful juices that are released from meat during cooking. They can be used to make gravies, sauces, or flavoring agents for other dishes. Meat drippings can be high in fat and calories, so moderation is key.

Animal fat,bacon grease.description: Bacon grease is the rendered fat that is left over after cooking bacon. It has a smoky, savory flavor and is often used as a cooking fat for vegetables, eggs, or other dishes. Bacon grease is high in saturated fat and should be used sparingly.

Salad dressing,italian,fat free.description: Fat-free Italian dressing is a lower-calorie alternative to regular Italian dressing. It's often made with vinegar, water, herbs, spices, and thickeners. It's important to check the label for sugar and sodium content.

Salad dressing,ranch.description: Ranch dressing is a creamy salad dressing that's typically made with buttermilk, mayonnaise, herbs, and spices. It can be high in calories and fat, so moderation is key. There are lower-fat versions available.

Salad dressing,mayonnaise,reduced fat.description: Reduced-fat mayonnaise is a lower-fat alternative to regular mayonnaise. It's often made with less oil or with lower-fat oils. It's important to check the label for specific fat and calorie content.

Chicken,canned.description: Canned chicken is a convenient source of protein. It's cooked and canned for preservation. It's essential to choose varieties that are lower in sodium and packed in water rather than oil.

Chicken,feet.description: Chicken feet are a good source of collagen and gelatin. They're often used in soups, stews, and stocks to add flavor and texture. Chicken feet require a longer cooking time to break down the connective tissues.

Soup,stock,beef.description: Beef stock is a flavorful liquid made by simmering beef bones, meat, and vegetables in water. It's often used as a base for soups, stews, and sauces. Beef stock can be high in sodium, so choosing low-sodium varieties or making your own is a good idea.

Soup,stock,chicken.description: Chicken stock is a flavorful liquid made by simmering chicken bones, meat, and vegetables in water. It's often used as a base for soups, stews, and sauces. Chicken stock can be high in sodium, so choosing low-sodium varieties or making your own is a good idea.

Gravy,brown.description: Brown gravy is a savory sauce made from meat juices, stock, and thickeners. It's often served with roasted meats, mashed potatoes, and other dishes. Brown gravy can be high in fat and sodium, so moderation is key.

Gravy,instant beef.description: Instant beef gravy is a convenient alternative to making gravy from scratch. It's typically made with dehydrated beef stock, thickeners, and seasonings. It's important to check the label for sodium and artificial ingredient content.

Gravy,instant turkey.description: Instant turkey gravy is a convenient alternative to making gravy from scratch. It's typically made with dehydrated turkey stock, thickeners, and seasonings. It's important to check the label for sodium and artificial ingredient content.

Sauce,chili.description: Chili sauce is a condiment made from chili peppers, vinegar, and other spices. It's often used as a dipping sauce or added to dishes for extra flavor and heat.

Soup,broth,fish.description: Fish broth is a flavorful liquid made by simmering fish bones, heads, and vegetables in water. It's often used as a base for soups, stews, and sauces. Fish broth can be high in sodium, so choosing low-sodium varieties or making your own is a good idea.

Soup,tomato,low sodium.description: Low-sodium tomato soup is a healthier alternative to regular tomato soup, which can be high in sodium. It's often made with tomatoes, broth, and seasonings.

Soup,pea,low sodium.description: Low-sodium pea soup is a healthier alternative to regular pea soup, which can be high in sodium. It's often made with peas, broth, and seasonings.

Soup,potato.description: Potato soup is a creamy and comforting soup made with potatoes, broth, and often cream or milk. It can be high in calories and fat, so moderation is key.

Sauce,tomato chili.description: Tomato chili sauce is a versatile condiment made with tomatoes, chili peppers, and other spices. It can be used as a dipping sauce, added to dishes for extra flavor and heat, or used as a base for other sauces.

Soup,beef and mushroom.description: Beef and mushroom soup is a savory and hearty soup made with beef, mushrooms, broth, and often vegetables. It can be high in sodium, so choosing low-sodium varieties or making your own is a good idea.

Soup,bouillon cubes.description: Bouillon cubes are dehydrated stock cubes that are often used as a convenient way to add flavor to soups, stews, and sauces. They can be high in sodium, so it's essential to use them sparingly or choose low-sodium varieties.

Wiener,fat free.description: Fat-free wieners are a lower-fat alternative to regular wieners, which are often high in fat and saturated fat. They're typically made with leaner cuts of meat and may contain added fillers or binders.

Pork/ham/chicken,canned.description: Canned pork, ham, and chicken are convenient protein sources. They're cooked and canned for preservation. It's essential to choose varieties that are lower in sodium and packed in water rather than oil.

Blackberry juice.description: Blackberry juice is a rich source of antioxidants and vitamins. It has a tart, sweet flavor and can be enjoyed on its own or used in smoothies and cocktails.

Cranberry,dried.description: Dried cranberries are tart and chewy snacks that are high in antioxidants. They're often sweetened with sugar or fruit juice concentrate, so moderation is key.

Olive,pickled.description: Pickled olives are olives that have been cured in a brine solution, often with herbs and spices. They have a salty, briny flavor and can be enjoyed as a snack or used in salads and cocktails.

Tangerine,(mandarin).description: Tangerines, also known as mandarins, are small citrus fruits with a sweet and tangy flavor. They're easy to peel and a good source of vitamin C.

Date.description: Dates are sweet and chewy fruits that are high in fiber, potassium, and antioxidants. They can be eaten fresh or dried and are often used in desserts and energy bars.

Pineapple,extra sweet.description: Extra sweet pineapple is a variety of pineapple that's known for its high sugar content. While it offers some vitamins and minerals, it's best enjoyed in moderation due to its sugar content.

Pork,variety meats and by-products.description: Pork variety meats and by-products include organs like liver, kidneys, and heart, as well as other parts like tails and ears. They can be good sources of nutrients but are also high in cholesterol. It's important to cook them thoroughly.

Broccoli raab.description: Broccoli raab, also known as rapini, is a green vegetable with a slightly bitter flavor. It's a good source of vitamins and minerals and can be sautéed, steamed, or roasted.

Lettuce,red leaf.description: Red leaf lettuce has tender, flavorful leaves with a slightly sweet taste. It's often used in salads, sandwiches, and wraps.

Onion,young green.description: Young green onions have a milder flavor compared to mature onions. They can be eaten raw or cooked and are often used as a garnish.

Pickles,chowchow.description: Chowchow is a type of pickled relish made with vegetables like cabbage, cucumbers, and onions. It often has a sweet and tangy flavor and is used as a condiment.

Coffee,brewed,espresso,decaffeinated.description: Decaffeinated espresso is similar in flavor to regular espresso but without most of the caffeine. It's made by brewing decaffeinated coffee beans under high pressure.

Drink,breakfast type,orange.description: Orange breakfast drinks can be a convenient way to get a dose of vitamin C. However, it's essential to choose varieties that are lower in sugar and made with real orange juice. Look for options without added sweeteners or artificial ingredients.

Hot chocolate,low calorie.description: Low-calorie hot chocolate is a lighter alternative to traditional hot chocolate. It's often made with skim milk or water, unsweetened cocoa powder, and artificial sweeteners. It's important to check the label for sugar and calorie content.

Peanut butter,smooth.description: Smooth peanut butter is made from ground peanuts. It's a good source of protein, healthy fats, and fiber. Choose natural peanut butter without added sugar, oil, or salt.

Plant-based beverage,soy,chocolate.description: Chocolate soy milk is a plant-based milk alternative that's flavored with chocolate. It's often fortified with vitamins and minerals. Choose varieties that are lower in sugar and made with real cocoa powder.

Breakfast tart.description: Breakfast tarts are individual pastries that are often filled with eggs, cheese, and vegetables. They can be a convenient and portable breakfast option. The nutritional content can vary depending on the ingredients used.

Candies,reesestics.description: Reese's Sticks are a popular candy that combines peanut butter and chocolate. They're high in sugar, fat, and calories, so they're best enjoyed in moderation.

Candies,kit kat.description: Kit Kat is a popular candy bar that consists of wafers coated in chocolate. They're high in sugar, fat, and calories, so they're best enjoyed in moderation.

Candies,reese's,fast break.description: Reese's Fast Break is a candy bar that combines peanut butter, chocolate, and pretzels. They're high in sugar, fat, and calories, so they're best enjoyed in moderation.

Dessert,frozen,ice cream,chocolate.description: Chocolate ice cream is a popular frozen dessert that's high in sugar, fat, and calories. It's best enjoyed in moderation.

Deli-meat,macaroni and cheese loaf.description: A processed meat product combined with a macaroni and cheese filling. This loaf is generally high in carbohydrates, fat, and sodium, and low in nutritional value. It's often served cold or heated as a quick and easy meal or snack.

Deli-meat,salami.description: A cured sausage with a distinctive fermented flavor. Salami is high in fat and sodium, but it's also a good source of protein and iron. Enjoy it in moderation as part of a cheese board or sandwich.

Wiener,regular.description: A cooked sausage typically made from beef, pork, or a combination. Wieners are high in fat and sodium and should be consumed in moderation. They're often served in buns as hot dogs or used in dishes like casseroles.

Coffee,instant,mocha.description: A quick and easy way to enjoy a mocha-flavored coffee beverage. It typically contains coffee, sugar, milk powder, and cocoa. Check the label for added sugars and adjust consumption based on your dietary needs.

Drink,orange flavour.description: A general term that could refer to a variety of beverages with orange flavor, including fruit juices, sports drinks, and sodas. Be mindful of sugar content, as it can vary greatly between products. Choose 100% fruit juice options for a healthier alternative.

Candies,twizzlers nibs.description: Bite-sized pieces of Twizzlers candy, primarily made from sugar, corn syrup, and artificial flavorings. These candies provide minimal nutritional value and are high in sugar. Consume them sparingly as an occasional treat.

Candies,york bites.description: Bite-sized chocolate-covered peppermint patties. They're high in sugar and fat, offering a sweet and minty flavor. Enjoy them in moderation as part of a balanced diet.

Candies,reese's bites.description: Chocolate-covered peanut butter candies. These bites offer a combination of sweet and salty flavors but are high in sugar and fat. Enjoy them occasionally as a treat.

Candies,almond joy bites.description: Bite-sized candies with a coconut center, topped with an almond and coated in chocolate. They're high in sugar and fat, providing a combination of sweet and nutty flavors. Enjoy them in moderation as a treat.

Candied almonds.description: Almonds coated in a sweet, sugary shell. While almonds offer nutritional benefits, the added sugar makes candied almonds a treat to be enjoyed in moderation. They can provide some protein, fiber, and healthy fats.

Pectin.description: A soluble fiber found in fruits, often used as a gelling agent in jams and jellies. Pectin can aid digestion and may help regulate blood sugar levels. It's naturally present in fruits like apples and citrus fruits.

Dessert,frozen,juice,orange.description: A frozen treat made primarily from orange juice. This dessert is a good source of vitamin C and can be a refreshing and lower-calorie alternative to ice cream. Look for options with no added sugar for a healthier choice.

Dessert,frozen,juice with cream.description: A frozen dessert combining fruit juice with cream or milk. It's generally higher in fat and calories compared to juice-based options. Check the label for sugar content and choose options with lower fat and sugar for a more balanced treat.

Grayling.description: A freshwater fish known for its delicate flavor and tender flesh. Grayling is a good source of protein, omega-3 fatty acids, and vitamin D. It can be grilled, baked, or pan-fried and served with various sides.

Chicken,wing,frozen.description: Raw chicken wings that have been frozen for preservation. They're a versatile protein source and can be baked, fried, or grilled. Be sure to cook them thoroughly to an internal temperature of 165°F (74°C) to eliminate any bacteria.

Soup,ramen noodles,beef flavour.description: A type of instant noodle soup with beef flavoring. Ramen noodles are generally high in carbohydrates and sodium but low in other nutrients. They can be a quick and inexpensive meal option but should be consumed in moderation.

Soup,ramen noodles,chicken flavour.description: An instant noodle soup flavored with chicken. Like other ramen varieties, it's often high in sodium and carbohydrates. Check the label for specific nutritional information and enjoy in moderation.

Dessert,frozen,fudgesicle bar.description: A frozen dessert consisting of chocolate-flavored ice cream on a stick. Fudgesicles are a treat high in sugar and fat. Enjoy them occasionally as part of a balanced diet.

Dessert,frozen,popsicle pop.description: A frozen treat typically made from fruit juice, water, and sugar. Popsicles can be a refreshing and lower-calorie alternative to ice cream, but be mindful of added sugar content. Choose options with 100% fruit juice and no added sugar for a healthier choice.

Dessert,frozen,ice cream,chocolate,low f.description: A lower-fat version of chocolate ice cream. While it may contain less fat than regular ice cream, it can still be high in sugar. Check the label for specific nutritional information and enjoy in moderation.

Agutuk.description: A traditional Inuit dessert made from whipped animal fat, berries, and sometimes sugar. Agutuk is high in calories and fat, providing energy and essential nutrients in cold climates. It's often made with local berries like crowberries or blueberries.

Ascidians.description: Also known as sea squirts, ascidians are marine animals that are a source of food in some cultures. They have a chewy texture and a mildly salty flavor. Ascidians can be eaten raw, cooked, or dried and are a source of protein and minerals.

Chiton.description: A type of marine mollusk with a shell made of eight plates. Chitons are a traditional food source for some coastal communities. They have a chewy texture and a flavor that can vary depending on the species and preparation method.

Fish,devilfish.description: A term that can refer to different types of fish, including octopus and anglerfish. These fish are a good source of protein, omega-3 fatty acids, and minerals. The taste and texture can vary widely depending on the specific type of devilfish.

Fish,herring eggs.description: A delicacy in some cultures, herring eggs, also known as roe, are a concentrated source of nutrients. They're rich in protein, omega-3 fatty acids, vitamin D, and minerals. Herring eggs can be eaten raw, pickled, or smoked.

Mashu roots.description: A traditional food source for indigenous peoples in the Pacific Northwest. Mashu roots, also known as wapato, are tubers that grow in water. They have a starchy texture and a slightly sweet flavor. Mashu roots can be boiled, roasted, or ground into flour.

Fish,oopah.description: A large, deep-bodied fish found in tropical and subtropical waters. Opah is prized for its rich, buttery flavor and moist texture. It's a good source of protein, omega-3 fatty acids, and selenium. Opah can be grilled, baked, or pan-fried.

Sourdock.description: A type of wild spinach native to North America. Sourdock has a tangy, lemony flavor and is a good source of vitamins A and C. It can be eaten raw in salads or cooked like spinach.

Willow.description: A type of tree with bark that contains salicin, a compound with pain-relieving properties. Willow bark has been used traditionally to treat headaches and inflammation. Consult a healthcare professional before using willow bark medicinally.

Netted willow.description: A specific species of willow tree. Like other willows, netted willow bark contains salicin and has been used for its medicinal properties. However, it's essential to use it under the guidance of a healthcare professional.

Mountain sorrel.description: A type of edible wild plant found in mountainous regions. Mountain sorrel has a tangy, lemony flavor and is a good source of vitamin C. It can be eaten raw in salads or cooked like spinach.

Black crowberry.description: A small, dark berry that grows in cold climates. Black crowberries are tart and astringent but high in antioxidants. They're traditionally used in jams, jellies, and baked goods.

Cloudberry.description: A delicate berry that grows in cold, boggy areas. Cloudberries have a tart, tangy flavor and are high in vitamin C and antioxidants. They're often used in jams, sauces, and desserts.

Sea cucumber.description: A marine animal with a leathery skin and an elongated body. Sea cucumbers are considered a delicacy in some Asian cuisines. They have a gelatinous texture and a mild, slightly sweet flavor. Sea cucumbers are low in calories and fat and a source of protein and minerals.

Beef,chuck,cross rib roast.description: A flavorful and economical cut of beef from the shoulder area. It benefits from slow cooking methods like braising or roasting to tenderize the meat. Cross rib roast is marbled with fat, which adds flavor during cooking.

Beef,chuck,blade roast.description: Another flavorful cut from the chuck, known for its rich taste. Like the cross rib roast, blade roast is best cooked using slow and moist heat methods. It can be roasted, braised, or used for pot roast.

Beef,chuck,blade steak.description: A cut from the chuck primal, known for its beefy flavor. Blade steak is more flavorful but tougher than other cuts. Marinating or tenderizing the steak before grilling, pan-frying, or broiling can help improve its tenderness.

Clementine.description: A small citrus fruit, easy to peel and known for its sweet and tangy flavor. Clementines are a good source of vitamin C, an antioxidant that supports immune health. They make a great snack and can be added to salads or desserts.

Mushroom,portabella.description: A large, meaty mushroom with a rich, earthy flavor. Portabella mushrooms are low in calories and fat, making them a healthy addition to meals. They can be grilled, roasted, or sautéed and used in various dishes.

Onion,yellow.description: A common variety of onion with a pungent flavor and a sharp aroma when raw. Yellow onions are a good source of antioxidants and add flavor to savory dishes. They are often used in soups, stews, and sauces.

Sports drink,orange flavour.description: A beverage designed to rehydrate and replenish electrolytes lost during physical activity. Sports drinks often contain sugar and electrolytes. Choose options with lower sugar content and avoid excessive consumption.

Sports drink.description: A general term for beverages designed to replace fluids and electrolytes lost during exercise. Sports drinks typically contain carbohydrates, electrolytes, and sometimes vitamins. They can be beneficial for intense or prolonged workouts but are not necessary for everyday activity.

Fish,salmon,pink.description: A species of salmon with a milder flavor and a lower fat content than other varieties. Pink salmon is a good source of protein, omega-3 fatty acids, and potassium. It can be grilled, baked, or canned.

Veggie burger patty.description: A plant-based alternative to traditional meat patties, often made from vegetables, legumes, or grains. Veggie burger patties can vary in nutritional content, so check the label for specific information. They can be a good source of fiber and protein.

Waffle,buttermilk.description: A type of waffle made with buttermilk, which adds a tangy flavor and a tender texture. Waffles are typically high in carbohydrates and can be topped with various ingredients. Choose whole-grain options and limit sugary toppings for a healthier meal.

Waffle,plain.description: A basic waffle recipe without any added flavors or mix-ins. Like buttermilk waffles, plain waffles are primarily carbohydrates. They can be customized with various toppings, from sweet to savory.

Sweetener,aspartame.description: An artificial sweetener that is much sweeter than sugar. Aspartame is commonly found in diet drinks and sugar-free products. It's important to note that some individuals may experience side effects from aspartame consumption.

Sweetener,sucralose.description: Another artificial sweetener that is significantly sweeter than sugar. Sucralose is heat-stable and often used in baking and cooking. It's generally considered safe for consumption, but individual tolerance may vary.

Sweetener.description: A broad term that encompasses both natural and artificial substances used to sweeten foods and beverages. Sweeteners can range from sugar and honey to artificial sweeteners like aspartame and sucralose.

Sweets,sugars,fructose.description: A simple sugar found naturally in fruits and honey. Fructose is sweeter than glucose, another type of sugar. While naturally occurring fructose in fruits is part of a healthy diet, excessive consumption of added fructose can contribute to health issues.

Beef,hip,eye of round roast.description: A lean cut of beef from the hip that is best cooked using moist heat methods like braising or stewing. Eye of round roast is relatively low in fat and can be sliced for sandwiches or served as a pot roast.

Beef,hip,eye of round steak.description: A lean and flavorful steak from the hip, suitable for grilling, pan-frying, or broiling. Eye of round steak benefits from marinating to enhance its tenderness and flavor.

Beef,flank,flank steak.description: A flavorful but tough cut of beef from the abdominal muscles. Flank steak is best marinated and cooked quickly over high heat. It's often sliced thinly against the grain for tenderness.

Beef,hip,inside round roast.description: A lean cut from the hip that is best suited for roasting or braising. Inside round roast can be cooked to medium-rare or medium and is often served as a traditional roast beef.

Beef,hip,inside round steak.description: A lean steak from the hip, known for its mild flavor. Inside round steak benefits from marinating and is best cooked using moist heat methods to ensure tenderness.

Beef,hip,outside round roast.description: A flavorful and relatively lean roast from the hip. Outside round roast can be roasted or braised and is often served as a traditional roast beef.

Beef,hip,outside round steak.description: A flavorful and lean steak from the hip. Outside round steak is best marinated and cooked using moist heat methods to tenderize the meat.

Beef,rib,rib eye roast.description: A tender and flavorful roast from the rib section, known for its rich marbling. Rib eye roast is best roasted or grilled and is a popular choice for special occasions.

Beef,rib,rib eye steak.description: One of the most tender and flavorful cuts of steak, known for its rich marbling. Rib eye steak can be grilled, pan-fried, or broiled. Its marbling makes it ideal for cooking to medium-rare or medium.

Beef,rib,rib roast.description: A large roast that includes several ribs, offering a combination of tender meat and flavorful bones. Rib roast is a popular choice for holidays and special gatherings. It's best roasted to an internal temperature of 135°F (57°C) for medium-rare.

Beef,hip,sirloin tip roast.description: A lean and flavorful roast from the sirloin tip, suitable for roasting or braising. Sirloin tip roast is best cooked using moist heat methods to ensure tenderness.

Beef,hip,sirloin tip steak.description: A flavorful and lean steak from the sirloin tip. Sirloin tip steak benefits from marinating and can be grilled, pan-fried, or broiled.

Beef,loin,strip loin roast.description: A tender and flavorful roast from the loin, known for its rich marbling. Strip loin roast is a popular choice for special occasions and is best roasted to an internal temperature of 135°F (57°C) for medium-rare.

Beef,loin,strip loin steak.description: A highly desirable and tender steak from the loin, known for its flavorful marbling. Strip loin steak, also called New York strip steak, is best grilled, pan-fried, or broiled.

Beef,loin,t-bone steak.description: A large and flavorful steak that includes a T-shaped bone separating the strip steak and the tenderloin. T-bone steak is a popular choice for grilling and offers a combination of tenderness and flavor.

Beef,loin,tenderloin,roast.description: The most tender cut of beef, known for its buttery texture and mild flavor. Tenderloin roast is best roasted or grilled and is a luxurious choice for special occasions.

Beef,loin,tenderloin,steak.description: The most tender cut of steak, known for its melt-in-your-mouth texture. Tenderloin steak, also called filet mignon, can be grilled, pan-fried, or broiled. It's best cooked to rare or medium-rare to preserve its tenderness.

Beef,loin,top sirloin steak.description: A flavorful and lean steak from the sirloin. Top sirloin steak is best marinated and can be grilled, pan-fried, or broiled.

Beef,loin,bottom sirloin tri-tip roast.description: A triangular roast from the bottom sirloin, known for its flavor. Tri-tip roast is best cooked using indirect heat, such as grilling or roasting.

Beef,loin,bottom sirloin tri-tip steak.description: A flavorful and tender steak from the bottom sirloin. Tri-tip steak is best grilled, roasted, or pan-fried.

Pork,loin,rib roast.description: A tender and flavorful roast from the loin of the pig, often containing a portion of the rib bones. Pork loin rib roast is a popular choice for roasts and is best cooked to an internal temperature of 145°F (63°C).

Beef,composite cuts.description: Refers to cuts of beef that are made up of multiple muscles from different parts of the animal. These cuts are often ground or processed to create products like ground beef, sausages, or patties.

Sweets,maple.description: Refers to sweeteners derived from the sap of maple trees, such as maple syrup and maple sugar. Maple syrup is a natural sweetener that contains antioxidants and minerals like manganese and zinc. However, it is still high in sugar and should be consumed in moderation.

Rhea.description: Rhea meat is a red meat similar in taste and texture to beef or ostrich. It is a good source of protein, iron, and other nutrients. Rhea meat is leaner than beef and can be cooked using various methods like grilling, roasting, or pan-frying.

Grains,rice,white,glutinous.description: A type of short-grain rice known for its sticky texture when cooked. Glutinous rice, also known as sticky rice, is commonly used in Asian cuisine for dishes like sushi and desserts. It is high in carbohydrates and should be consumed in moderation as part of a balanced diet.

Cracker,wheat.description: A type of cracker made from wheat flour. Wheat crackers can vary in nutritional content depending on the ingredients used. Look for options made with whole-grain wheat flour for more fiber and nutrients. Crackers can be a convenient snack but are often high in sodium, so check the label before consuming.

Vinegar,red wine.description: A type of vinegar made from fermented red wine. Red wine vinegar has a complex flavor and is often used in salad dressings, marinades, and sauces. It contains antioxidants and may have some health benefits, but more research is needed.

Vinegar,balsamic.description: A type of aged vinegar made from cooked grape must. Balsamic vinegar has a sweet, tangy flavor and is often used in salad dressings, marinades, and as a condiment. It is thought to have some health benefits, but more research is needed.

Sauce,pizza.description: A tomato-based sauce commonly used as a base for pizzas. Pizza sauce typically contains tomatoes, herbs, and spices. Check the label for sodium content, as it can vary between brands.

Sauce,sweet and sour.description: A sauce that combines sweet and sour flavors, often used in Asian cuisine. Sweet and sour sauce is typically made with sugar, vinegar, and other ingredients like pineapple juice or soy sauce. It can be high in sugar, so consume in moderation.

Guava nectar.description: A sweet and flavorful juice made from guava fruit. Guava nectar is a good source of vitamin C and dietary fiber. Choose 100% guava nectar without added sugar for a healthier option.

Mango nectar.description: A sweet and creamy juice made from mango fruit. Mango nectar is a good source of vitamins A and C. Choose 100% mango nectar without added sugar for a healthier choice.

Pork,pickled.description: Pork that has been preserved in a brine or vinegar solution. Pickled pork is a traditional food in many cultures and can be eaten cold or cooked. It is high in sodium and should be consumed in moderation.

Soybeans,green.description: Immature soybeans that are harvested before they fully mature. Green soybeans, also known as edamame, are a good source of protein, fiber, and vitamins. They can be boiled, steamed, or roasted and eaten as a snack or added to dishes.

Mushroom,maitake.description: A type of edible mushroom with a distinctive feathery appearance. Maitake mushrooms have a savory, earthy flavor and are a good source of antioxidants and vitamins. They can be sautéed, roasted, or used in soups and stews.

Toaster pastry,fruit.description: A type of processed pastry filled with fruit-flavored filling. Toaster pastries are often high in sugar, refined carbohydrates, and unhealthy fats. They provide minimal nutritional value and should be consumed sparingly.

Dessert,egg custard,baked.description: A classic dessert made with eggs, milk, and sugar, baked until set. Baked egg custard is a good source of protein and calcium. It can be flavored with vanilla, nutmeg, or other spices.

Dessert,mousse,chocolate.description: A light and airy dessert made with chocolate, eggs, and cream. Chocolate mousse is rich in flavor and texture but also high in calories and fat. Enjoy in moderation as a treat.

Dessert,apple crisp.description: A baked dessert with a layer of sliced apples topped with a crispy crumble made from oats, flour, butter, and sugar. Apple crisp is a classic comfort food but can be high in sugar and fat. Choose recipes with less sugar and use whole-grain oats for a healthier version.

Candies,praline.description: A type of candy made from nuts and sugar, often in the form of a brittle or a creamy spread. Pralines are high in sugar and calories but provide some protein and healthy fats from the nuts. Enjoy in moderation as a treat.

Candies,snickers almond bar.description: A candy bar consisting of nougat, caramel, and almonds coated in milk chocolate. Snickers Almond bars are high in sugar, fat, and calories. Enjoy in moderation as a treat.

Candies,taffy.description: A chewy candy made from sugar, corn syrup, butter, and flavorings. Taffy is high in sugar and provides minimal nutritional value. Enjoy in moderation as a treat.

Candies,toffee.description: A type of candy made by caramelizing sugar and butter together. Toffee is often combined with nuts or chocolate. It is high in sugar and fat. Enjoy in moderation as a treat.

Candies,divinity.description: A type of candy made from egg whites, sugar, corn syrup, and nuts. Divinity is light and airy in texture and often flavored with vanilla or peppermint. It is high in sugar. Enjoy in moderation as a treat.

Snacks,popcorn,unpopped kernels.description: Unpopped kernels are whole-grain and a good source of fiber. When air-popped, popcorn is a low-calorie, whole-grain snack. Avoid excessive butter, salt, or sugary toppings.

Snacks,sweet potato chips.description: Sweet potato chips can be a healthier alternative to regular potato chips, offering some vitamins and fiber. Choose baked or lightly fried options and watch out for added salt.

Snacks,multigrain chips.description: Multigrain chips can provide more fiber than regular chips, but check the label for whole grains. Be mindful of added oils, salt, and calorie content.

Salmonberry.description: Salmonberries are a good source of Vitamin C and antioxidants. They have a tart, juicy flavor and can be eaten fresh or used in jams and desserts.

Chokecherry.description: Chokecherries have a tart and astringent flavor. They are high in antioxidants and have been used traditionally for medicinal purposes. Be cautious about consuming large quantities raw, as the seeds contain cyanide compounds.

Corn,dried.description: Dried corn, often ground into cornmeal, is a staple food in many cultures. It is a good source of carbohydrates and provides some fiber and nutrients.

Fish,dried.description: Dried fish is a method of preserving fish and a good source of protein. It is often high in sodium, so consume in moderation.

Frybread.description: Frybread is a traditional food in some indigenous cultures. While it holds cultural significance, frybread is high in calories, refined carbohydrates, and fat. Consume it sparingly as part of a balanced diet.

Agave.description: Agave is a natural sweetener derived from the agave plant. It is sweeter than sugar but has a lower glycemic index. Consume agave in moderation, as with any sweetener.

Broccoli,flower clusters.description: Broccoli florets are packed with Vitamin C, Vitamin K, and folate. They are a good source of fiber and antioxidants. Enjoy them steamed, roasted, or stir-fried.

Broccoli,stalks.description: Don't discard broccoli stalks! They are just as nutritious as the florets, containing fiber and Vitamin C. Peel and slice them for stir-fries, or roast them alongside the florets.

Broccoli,leaves.description: Broccoli leaves are edible and nutritious! They are a good source of vitamins A, C, and K. Use them in stir-fries, soups, or smoothies.

Jam type spread.description: Jam and similar spreads are typically high in sugar. Check labels for fruit content and choose options with less added sugar or those sweetened with fruit juice concentrate.

Juice,tomato,canned.description: Canned tomato juice can be a good source of lycopene, an antioxidant. Choose low-sodium varieties and enjoy it as a base for soups or sauces.

Pork,composite cuts.description: Similar to beef, composite pork cuts are made from various parts of the animal and are often ground or processed. Be mindful of fat and sodium content in these products.

Kefir.description: Kefir is a fermented milk drink that contains probiotics, which can be beneficial for gut health. It's also a good source of calcium and protein. Enjoy kefir as part of a balanced diet.

Deli-meat,prosciutto.description: Prosciutto is a dry-cured ham, enjoyed thinly sliced. It's flavorful but high in sodium, so consume in moderation. Enjoy it as part of a charcuterie board or in sandwiches.

Cream substitute.description: Cream substitutes can vary widely in ingredients and nutritional content. Some may be lower in fat or calories than heavy cream, while others might contain added sugars or artificial ingredients. Check the label to make informed choices.

Seasoning mix,taco.description: Taco seasoning mixes can add flavor to your dishes but are often high in sodium. Check the label and choose low-sodium options or make your own blend using spices like chili powder, cumin, and paprika.

Salad dressing,honey mustard.description: Honey mustard dressing combines the sweetness of honey with the tanginess of mustard. It can be high in sugar and sodium, so check the label and choose options with lower amounts or make your own at home.

Chicken patty.description: Chicken patties can be a convenient source of protein, but their nutritional value can vary depending on the ingredients and cooking method. Choose patties made with lean ground chicken and avoid those that are breaded or fried.

Chicken breast tenders.description: Chicken tenders are made from the tenderloin portion of the chicken breast. They can be a healthy and lean protein source when baked or grilled. Avoid breading and frying, which adds extra calories and fat.

Sauce,spaghetti.description: Spaghetti sauce is typically made with tomatoes, herbs, and spices. Choose low-sodium varieties and check for added sugar content. You can also easily make your own spaghetti sauce at home using fresh ingredients.

Bar,milk and cereal.description: Milk and cereal bars can be a convenient snack but often contain added sugars and processed ingredients. Check the label for whole grains, protein content, and sugar content. Choose bars with less sugar and more fiber.

Water,fruit flavour.description: Fruit-flavored water can be a refreshing alternative to sugary drinks. However, many brands contain added sugars or artificial sweeteners. Choose options that are naturally flavored and sugar-free.

Dessert,frozen,light ice cream.description: Light ice cream typically contains less fat and calories than regular ice cream. However, it may still be high in sugar. Check the label for specific nutritional information and enjoy in moderation.

Snacks,popcorn,microwave.description: Microwave popcorn can be a quick and easy snack, but some varieties contain added butter, flavorings, and high amounts of sodium. Choose lightly salted or unsalted options and check the label for unhealthy additives.

Snacks,pretzels,soft.description: Soft pretzels are often high in refined carbohydrates and sodium. Enjoy them in moderation as part of a balanced diet.

Snacks,soy chips.description: Soy chips can be a good source of protein and fiber, but check the label for sodium and fat content. Choose baked or lightly fried options over those that are heavily processed.

Cattail.description: Various parts of the cattail plant are edible, including the shoots, roots, and pollen. Cattails are a good source of carbohydrates and fiber and have been a traditional food source for some indigenous cultures.

Rose hips.description: Rose hips are the fruit of the rose plant and are high in Vitamin C and antioxidants. They can be eaten raw, dried, or used to make teas, jams, and jellies.

Milk,goat.description: Goat milk is a good source of calcium, protein, and probiotics. It has a slightly different taste and composition compared to cow's milk and may be easier to digest for some people.

Cereal,ready-to-eat,amaranth flakes.description: Amaranth flakes are a gluten-free grain that is a good source of protein, fiber, and iron. Enjoy them as a hot cereal or add them to granola bars and other recipes.

Blackberry,wild.description: Wild blackberries are a good source of antioxidants and fiber. They have a sweet and slightly tart flavor and can be enjoyed fresh, in jams, or baked goods.

Blueberry,wild.description: Wild blueberries are smaller than cultivated blueberries but packed with antioxidants. They have a sweet and tangy flavor and are delicious fresh or in baked goods.

Bread,cornbread.description: Cornbread is a quick bread made with cornmeal. It can vary in nutritional content depending on the recipe. Choose versions made with less sugar and fat, and consider using whole-grain cornmeal for more fiber.

Bread,irish soda.description: Irish soda bread is a quick bread that uses baking soda as a leavening agent. It is typically dense and slightly crumbly. Look for versions made with whole-wheat flour for added fiber.

Cabbage,red.description: Red cabbage is a good source of Vitamin C and antioxidants. It has a slightly peppery flavor and can be eaten raw in salads, cooked, or fermented to make sauerkraut.

Cabbage,savoy.description: Savoy cabbage has tender, crinkled leaves and a milder flavor compared to regular cabbage. It's a good source of Vitamins C and K. Enjoy it in salads, stir-fries, or braised dishes.

Cake,shortcake.description: Shortcake is a sweet biscuit or cake typically served with fruit and whipped cream. It is high in calories, sugar, and fat. Enjoy in moderation as a treat.

Corn,sweet,white.description: White corn is a variety of sweet corn with white kernels. It is a good source of carbohydrates and fiber. Enjoy it grilled, roasted, or cut off the cob in salads and salsas.

Egg substitute,liquid.description: Liquid egg substitutes are often made from egg whites and may contain other ingredients like vegetable oil and flavorings. They can be lower in fat and cholesterol than whole eggs. Check the label for specific nutritional information.

Grapefruit juice,pink.description: Pink grapefruit juice is a good source of Vitamin C and antioxidants. Choose 100% grapefruit juice without added sugar for a healthier option.

Huckleberries.description: Huckleberries are small, round berries with a sweet and slightly tart flavor. They are high in antioxidants and have been a traditional food source for some indigenous cultures.

Beans,lima,baby.description: Baby lima beans are a good source of fiber, protein, and iron. They have a mild, buttery flavor and can be enjoyed in salads, soups, or side dishes.

Cereal,millet.description: Millet is a gluten-free grain that is a good source of protein, fiber, and magnesium. It has a nutty flavor and can be cooked as a porridge or used in grain bowls.

Oil,cooking spray.description: Cooking spray is a convenient way to add a small amount of oil to your cooking. Choose sprays made with healthy oils like olive oil or avocado oil and avoid those containing propellants or artificial ingredients.

Juice drink,orange.description: Orange juice drinks often contain a small percentage of actual juice and are mostly made from water, sugar, and flavorings. Choose 100% orange juice for more nutrients and less added sugar.

Pancake,whole wheat.description: Whole-wheat pancakes are a good source of fiber and can be a healthier alternative to those made with refined white flour. Look for recipes that use less sugar and incorporate healthy fats from sources like mashed banana or unsweetened applesauce.

Pepper,sweet,red.description: Red bell peppers are a good source of Vitamin C and antioxidants. They have a sweet flavor and can be enjoyed raw in salads, cooked in stir-fries, or stuffed and baked.

Potato,au gratin.description: Potatoes au gratin are a rich and creamy dish made with sliced potatoes, cheese, and milk or cream. It is high in calories, fat, and sodium. Enjoy in moderation as a treat.

Potato,whole.description: Whole potatoes are a good source of carbohydrates, Vitamin C, and potassium. They can be baked, roasted, or mashed. Avoid frying potatoes, which adds extra calories and unhealthy fats.

Pumpkin leaves.description: Pumpkin leaves are edible and nutritious, offering Vitamins A and C, iron, and calcium. They can be steamed, sautéed, or added to soups and stews.

Pumpkin flowers.description: Pumpkin flowers are a delicacy in some cultures. They have a delicate, slightly sweet flavor and can be stuffed, battered, and fried, or added to salads.

Raspberry,wild.description: Wild raspberries are smaller and more delicate than cultivated varieties. They have a sweet, slightly tart flavor and are high in antioxidants. Enjoy them fresh or use them in jams and desserts.

Salad dressing,sesame seed.description: Sesame seed dressing, often used in Asian cuisine, can be a good source of healthy fats from sesame seeds. Check the label for sodium content and added sugars.

Salad dressing,sweet and sour.description: Sweet and sour salad dressing often combines vinegar, sugar, and other flavorings. Choose options with lower sugar content or make your own at home using healthy sweeteners and ingredients.

Soybeans,mature seeds.description: Mature soybeans, often dried, are a good source of protein, fiber, and iron. They can be cooked in various ways and are used to make products like tofu, tempeh, and soy milk.

Squash,scallop.description: Scallop squash is a type of summer squash with a mild, slightly sweet flavor. It is a good source of Vitamins A and C. Enjoy it grilled, roasted, or sautéed.

Squash,zucchini.description: Versatile summer squash. Can be eaten raw or cooked. Good source of vitamin C and potassium.

Yardlong beans.description: Long, slender beans. Good source of vitamins A and C.

Stew,moose.description: Traditional dish made with moose meat. Good source of protein and iron. Can be high in fat depending on preparation.

Stew,caribou.description: Traditional dish made with caribou meat. Lean source of protein. Can be high in fat depending on preparation.

Sweet potato,baked.description: Good source of vitamin A, fiber, and antioxidants. Bake instead of frying for a healthier option.

Sweet roll,cinnamon.description: Sweet yeast bread. High in sugar, fat, and calories. Enjoy occasionally.

Taro leaves.description: Edible leaves of the taro plant. Should be cooked before eating. Good source of vitamins and minerals.

Taro shoots.description: Edible shoots of the taro plant. Good source of fiber and antioxidants.

Taro,tahitian.description: Starchy root vegetable. Good source of carbohydrates and fiber. Must be cooked before eating.

Tea,tundra.description: Herbal tea made from plants that grow in the tundra. May have medicinal properties.

Veal leg.description: Cut of meat from a young calf. Tender and delicate flavor. Can be roasted or braised.

Wheat.description: Grain used to make flour, bread, and other products. Good source of carbohydrates and fiber.

Granola bar,all bran.description: High in fiber. Can be a good source of whole grains. Check labels for sugar content.

Muffin bar.description: Portable snack or breakfast item. Can be high in sugar and fat. Check labels for nutritional content.

Granola bar,cereal bar.description: Convenient snack. Can vary greatly in nutritional value. Check labels for protein, fiber, and sugar content.

Egg,white.description: Fat-free and cholesterol-free source of protein. Often used in omelets and other dishes.

Indian,bread,naan.description: Soft and chewy flatbread. Often served with curries and other Indian dishes. Can be high in carbohydrates.

Dumpling,plain.description: Small, boiled dough. Can be filled with various ingredients. Nutritional content varies.

Vegetables,asian mix.description: Mix of vegetables commonly used in Asian cuisine. Good source of vitamins, minerals, and fiber.

Vegetables,broccoli and cauliflower.description: Two cruciferous vegetables that are good sources of vitamins, minerals, and fiber.

Lettuce,spring mix.description: Mix of tender baby lettuces. Low in calories and a good source of vitamins.

Bread pudding.description: Dessert made with bread, milk, eggs, and sugar. Can be high in calories and fat.

Sugar pie.description: Very sweet pie. High in sugar and calories. Enjoy as an occasional treat.

Butter tart.description: Sweet tart with a buttery filling. High in sugar, fat, and calories.

Cake,gingerbread.description: Spiced cake often made during the holidays. Contains ginger, cinnamon, and other spices. High in sugar and calories.

Cake,chocolate.description: Classic dessert. High in sugar, fat, and calories. Enjoy in moderation.

Cheesecake,plain.description: Rich and creamy dessert. High in fat and calories. Enjoy occasionally.

Cake,carrot.description: Moist cake made with carrots. Can be high in sugar and calories depending on the recipe.

Cookie,shortbread.description: Buttery and crumbly cookie. High in fat and calories. Enjoy in moderation.

Muffin,carrot.description: Can be a healthier muffin option. Contains carrots and often less sugar and fat than other muffins.

Muffin,chocolate chip.description: Sweet muffin. High in sugar, fat, and calories. Enjoy occasionally.

Cream,whipped.description: Light and fluffy topping. High in fat and calories. Use sparingly.

Chinese noodles.description: Variety of noodles used in Chinese cuisine. Can be made from wheat flour, rice flour, or mung bean starch.

Chicken,skin.description: High in fat and calories. Remove before eating to reduce fat intake.

Pomegranate juice.description: Good source of antioxidants. Can be high in sugar. Choose 100% juice with no added sugar.

Juice,apple and grape.description: Blend of apple and grape juice. Good source of vitamins. Can be high in sugar. Choose 100% juice with no added sugar.

Refried beans,vegetarian.description: Made from pinto beans without lard or animal fat. Good source of protein, fiber, and iron.

Pie crust,cookie-type.description: Crumbly pie crust. High in fat and calories. Enjoy in moderation.

Candies,chocolate,dark.description: Contains a higher percentage of cocoa solids than milk chocolate. Contains antioxidants. Choose varieties with a high percentage of cacao (70% or higher) and limited added sugar.

Grains,corn flour.description: Made from finely ground corn. Used in baking and as a thickening agent. Gluten-free.

Snacks,sunchips.description: Multigrain snack chips. Can be high in sodium and fat. Choose baked over fried.

Snacks,plantain chips.description: Made from plantains. Can be high in fat and sodium. Choose baked or air-fried options.

Snacks,tortilla chips,plain.description: Made from corn tortillas. Can be high in sodium and fat. Choose baked or low-sodium varieties.

Chinese dish,soup,egg drop.description: Light soup with egg ribbons. Can be a good source of protein. Often high in sodium.

Chinese dish,soup,hot and sour.description: Spicy and sour soup. Often high in sodium. Choose low-sodium options when possible.

Cereal,ready to eat,oatmeal squares.description: Can be a good source of fiber. Check labels for sugar content. Choose varieties with minimal added sugar.

Cereal,ready to eat,life.description: Breakfast cereal. Check labels for sugar, fiber, and whole grain content.

Tea,chai latte.description: Spiced tea with milk. Can be high in sugar and calories depending on preparation.

Coffee latte.description: Coffee drink with steamed milk. Can be high in calories and fat depending on milk and sweetener choices.

Vodka cooler.description: Alcoholic beverage. High in sugar and calories. Limit intake.

Alcohol,cocktail,margarita.description: Alcoholic cocktail. High in sugar and calories. Enjoy in moderation.

Sangria.description: Alcoholic beverage made with wine, fruit, and brandy. High in sugar and calories.

Cretons.description: Traditional French Canadian pork spread. High in fat and calories. Enjoy in moderation.

Fish,battered and fried.description: Unhealthy cooking method that increases fat and calorie content. Choose baked or grilled fish for a healthier option.

Fish cake.description: Made with fish, potatoes, and other ingredients. Can be high in fat and calories depending on preparation.

Egg,western omelet.description: Omelet filled with diced ham, onions, and peppers. Good source of protein and vegetables. Can be high in fat and cholesterol.

Egg,spanish omelet.description: Omelet with potatoes, onions, and other vegetables. Good source of protein and vegetables. Can be high in fat and cholesterol.

Egg,omelet.description: Versatile dish made with eggs and various fillings. Can be a healthy option if filled with vegetables and lean protein.

Egg benedict.description: Rich breakfast dish with poached eggs, hollandaise sauce, and ham or smoked salmon. High in fat and calories.

Egg,yolk.description: Contains fat, cholesterol, and nutrients. Consume in moderation as part of a balanced diet.

Egg substitute,frozen.description: Convenient alternative to fresh eggs. Lower in fat and cholesterol.

Cereal,ready to eat,jordans.description: Breakfast cereal. Check labels for sugar, fiber, and whole grain content.

Granola bar,chewy.description: Snack bar. Can vary greatly in nutritional content. Check labels for protein, fiber, and sugar content.

Soup,cream of vegetable.description: Can be high in sodium and fat. Choose low-sodium and low-fat varieties.

Soup,french onion.description: Made with onions, beef broth, and often topped with cheese and bread. Can be high in sodium.

Bread,garlic,toasted.description: Bread topped with garlic and butter or oil. Can be high in calories and fat. Enjoy in moderation.

Bread,potato.description: Made with mashed potatoes. Can be high in carbohydrates and calories. Enjoy in moderation.

Dip,cream cheese base.description: Made with cream cheese. High in fat and calories. Enjoy in moderation.

Dip,spinach.description: Made with spinach, sour cream, and mayonnaise. Can be high in fat and calories. Choose low-fat and low-calorie options.

Dip,sour cream base.description: Made with sour cream. High in fat and calories. Enjoy in moderation.

Dulce de leche.description: Caramel-like sauce made from sweetened condensed milk. High in sugar and calories. Enjoy sparingly.

Kiwi fruit,gold.description: Sweeter and less tart than green kiwi. Good source of vitamin C and fiber.

Cracker,whole-wheat.description: Made with whole wheat flour. Good source of fiber. Check labels for sodium content.

Waffle,chocolate chip.description: Sweet waffle. High in sugar, fat, and calories. Enjoy occasionally.

Sweets,sugars,brown.description: Refined sugar with molasses added back in. Contains some minerals, but still high in calories.

Candies,bar.description: Generic term for chocolate or candy bars. High in sugar, fat, and calories. Enjoy occasionally.

Snacks,vegetable chips.description: Made from various vegetables. Can be high in sodium and fat. Choose baked over fried.

Candy bits.description: Small pieces of candy. High in sugar and calories. Enjoy sparingly.

Snacks,bagel chips.description: Made from bagels that are sliced and toasted. Can be high in carbohydrates and sodium. Enjoy in moderation.

Sweets,turbinado.description: Raw sugar that retains some molasses. Contains some minerals, but still high in calories.

Sweetener,granulated brown sugar.description: Similar to brown sugar, but finer in texture. High in calories. Use in moderation.

Yogourt parfait.description: Layered dessert or breakfast parfait made with yogurt, fruit, and granola. Can be a healthy option depending on ingredients.

Gravy,beef.description: Savory sauce made from beef drippings. Can be high in fat and sodium. Enjoy in moderation.

Cereal,ready to eat,special k.description: Breakfast cereal. Check labels for sugar, fiber, and whole grain content.

Cereal,ready to eat,nature's path.description: Brand of breakfast cereals. Check labels for sugar, fiber, and whole grain content.

Turkey,hen,breast.description: Lean and protein-rich part of the turkey. Good source of niacin and vitamin B6. Versatile for various cooking methods.

Turkey,hen,drumstick.description: More tender than the turkey leg. Good source of protein, iron, and zinc. Requires longer cooking time to ensure tenderness.

Turkey,hen,thigh.description: More flavorful and juicy than the turkey breast. Good source of protein, iron, and zinc. Can be cooked with or without skin.

Turkey,hen,leg.description: Includes both the thigh and drumstick. Good source of protein, iron, and zinc. Best cooked with moist heat to ensure tenderness.

Turkey,hen,wing.description: Often enjoyed as a snack or appetizer. Contains some protein but mostly skin and bone. Can be high in fat.

Turkey,all classes.description: Refers to turkey meat from all classes of birds, including hens and toms. A good source of lean protein, niacin, and vitamin B6.

Turkey,all classes,breast.description: Leanest part of the turkey. Good source of protein, niacin, and vitamin B6. Versatile for various cooking methods.

Turkey,all classes,leg.description: Includes both the thigh and drumstick. Good source of protein, iron, and zinc. Best cooked with moist heat to ensure tenderness.

Turkey,all classes,drumstick.description: More tender than the turkey leg. Good source of protein, iron, and zinc. Requires longer cooking time to ensure tenderness.

Turkey,all classes,thigh.description: More flavorful and juicy than the turkey breast. Good source of protein, iron, and zinc. Can be cooked with or without skin.

Turkey,all classes,wing.description: Often enjoyed as a snack or appetizer. Contains some protein but mostly skin and bone. Can be high in fat.

Candies,chocolate covered coffee beans.description: Chocolate-covered coffee beans combine the flavors of chocolate and coffee. They're high in sugar, fat, and caffeine. Enjoy them in moderation as an occasional treat.

Snacks,tortilla chips,low fat.description: Low-fat tortilla chips are a lower-fat alternative to regular tortilla chips. They're often made with less oil or baked instead of fried. Check the label for sodium content.

Snacks,corn-based,extruded,puffs or twis.description: Corn-based extruded puffs or twists are often high in carbohydrates and calories. Choose varieties that are baked instead of fried and check the label for sodium content.

Snacks,tortilla chips,unsalted.description: Unsalted tortilla chips are a lower-sodium alternative to regular tortilla chips. They're often made with less oil or baked instead of fried. Choose varieties that are also low in fat.

Hot chocolate,cocoa.description: Hot cocoa made from cocoa powder is lower in sugar and fat compared to pre-sweetened mixes. Choose unsweetened cocoa powder and add your own natural sweetener.

Candies,soft fruit and nut squares.description: Soft fruit and nut squares are often high in sugar, fat, and calories. Enjoy them in moderation as an occasional treat. Check the ingredients list for added sugars and unhealthy fats.

Dessert,frozen,ice cream,vanilla.description: Vanilla ice cream is a classic frozen dessert that's high in sugar, fat, and calories. Choose low-fat or light varieties and enjoy it in moderation as part of a balanced diet.

Grains,oat flour.description: Oat flour is made from ground oats. It's gluten-free and a good source of fiber and protein. It can be used in baking to make pancakes, muffins, and cookies.

Sweets,syrups,grenadine.description: Grenadine syrup is a non-alcoholic bar syrup made from pomegranate juice, sugar, and water. It's used to add sweetness and a reddish color to cocktails and mocktails.

Drink,fruit flavour,powder.description: Fruit-flavored drink powders are often high in sugar and artificial ingredients. Choose sugar-free varieties or make your own fruit-flavored drinks with fresh fruit and water.

Salad dressing,creamy.description: Creamy salad dressings are typically high in fat, calories, and sodium. Choose low-fat or homemade versions with Greek yogurt or buttermilk for a healthier option.

Cheese,cheddar,imitation.description: Imitation cheddar cheese is a processed cheese product that may contain vegetable oils, whey, and artificial flavors. It's often lower in protein and calcium compared to real cheddar cheese.

Turkey bacon.description: Turkey bacon is a lower-fat alternative to pork bacon. It's made from ground turkey that's been seasoned and formed into strips. It's important to check the label for sodium content.

Dessert,frozen.description: The nutritional content of frozen desserts can vary widely depending on the type. Choose options that are lower in sugar, fat, and calories. Look for frozen yogurt, sorbet, or fruit-based desserts.

Salad dressing,peppercorn.description: Peppercorn salad dressing typically contains crushed peppercorns, vinegar, and oil. It adds a spicy and tangy flavor to salads. Choose varieties that are lower in fat and sodium.

Coffee whitener,liquid.description: Liquid coffee whitener is often high in sugar, unhealthy fats, and artificial ingredients. Choose milk or cream instead or look for healthier alternatives made with plant-based milks.

Orange-strawberry-banana juice.description: Orange-strawberry-banana juice is a good source of vitamin C and potassium. Choose varieties that are 100% juice and make sure they don't contain added sugars.

Tourtiere.description: A savory pie originating from Quebec, Canada, typically filled with ground pork, veal, or beef, spices like clove and cinnamon, and often potatoes or breadcrumbs. It's a hearty and flavorful dish traditionally served during Christmas and New Year's celebrations.

Turkey,broiler,drumstick.description: A good source of protein and niacin, turkey drumsticks are often preferred for their rich flavor and moist texture. They're lower in fat compared to some other cuts of poultry.

Turkey,broiler,thigh.description: Turkey thighs are a flavorful and juicy cut of meat.  They tend to be more forgiving to cook than the breast and remain moist even when cooked for longer periods.

Turkey,all classes,back.description: A less common cut of turkey, the back is often used to make stock or broth due to its high bone content. It can also be roasted but may require special care to prevent overcooking.

Sauce,hollandaise.description: A rich and creamy sauce made with butter, egg yolks, and lemon juice.  While delicious, it is high in fat and calories, best enjoyed in moderation.

Mushroom,shiitake.description: Shiitake mushrooms have a rich, umami flavor and a meaty texture. They are often used in Asian cuisine and are a good source of copper and B vitamins.

Plantain,green.description: Unlike the sweeter, ripe plantains, green plantains are starchy and typically eaten cooked.  They are a good source of resistant starch, which can be beneficial for gut health.

Mushroom,chanterelle.description: Prized for their delicate, slightly peppery flavor, chanterelles have a distinctive trumpet-like shape. They are a good source of vitamin D and potassium.

Mushroom,morel.description: Morels are highly sought after for their earthy, nutty, and slightly smoky flavor. They have a distinctive honeycomb-like appearance and are a good source of iron and fiber.

Turnip,prairie.description: Prairie turnips, also known as prairie apples, have a sweet and nutty flavor with a slightly starchy texture.  They were an important food source for Indigenous peoples in North America.

Stinging nettles.description: While they require careful handling due to their stinging hairs, stinging nettles are highly nutritious when cooked. They're rich in vitamins A and C, iron, and antioxidants. They can be used in soups, stews, or as a cooked green.

Yogurt.description: A dairy product made by fermenting milk with live bacteria. Yogurt is a good source of protein, calcium, and probiotics, which can contribute to a healthy gut.

Yogurt beverage.description: A thinner and more drinkable version of yogurt, often flavored with fruits, vanilla, or sweeteners. While a source of calcium and probiotics, be mindful of added sugar content.

Yogurt,fresh cheese-type.description: Similar in texture to cream cheese, fresh cheese-type yogurt is strained to remove excess whey. This results in a thicker, creamier yogurt that is higher in protein.

Yogurt,fruit flavoured.description: A popular choice for its added sweetness and flavor, be sure to check the sugar content, as some fruit-flavored yogurts can be high in added sugars.

Yogurt,with crunchy granola.description: A convenient breakfast or snack option, providing a combination of protein, carbohydrates, and healthy fats. Choose a granola that is low in added sugars and high in whole grains.

Yogurt,goat.description: Made from goat's milk, goat yogurt has a tangy flavor and a slightly different nutritional profile than cow's milk yogurt. It's often easier to digest for people with sensitivities to cow's milk.

Pear,bartlett.description: A popular variety of pear known for its juicy, sweet flavor. Pears are a good source of fiber, vitamin C, and antioxidants.

Apple,golden delicious.description: Sweet and mellow, Golden Delicious apples are a good choice for snacking and baking.  Apples are a good source of fiber and vitamin C.

Nuts,mixed nuts.description: A nutritious and convenient snack, providing a mix of healthy fats, protein, fiber, and vitamins and minerals. Choose unsalted or lightly salted varieties.

Sweetener,syrup,agave.description: A natural sweetener derived from the agave plant, agave syrup has a lower glycemic index than sugar but is still high in fructose. Use it in moderation.

Grains,rice and vermicelli mix.description: A combination of rice and thin noodles, this mix offers a slightly different texture to rice dishes. Check the package for nutritional information, as it varies depending on the specific blend.

Sauce,cheese and salsa.description: A creamy and spicy sauce, the nutritional content varies greatly depending on the types of cheese and salsa used. Be mindful of sodium and fat content.

Seaweed,canadian cultivated emi-tsunomat.description: A type of red seaweed cultivated in Canada, emi-tsunomata is a source of minerals, including iodine, which is important for thyroid function. It can be enjoyed in salads or as a snack.

Sweets,syrups,cane.description: A sweetener derived from sugarcane, cane syrup is high in sugar and should be consumed in moderation. It has a distinct molasses-like flavor.

Wiener,bavarian.description: A type of sausage typically made with pork and spices, Bavarian wieners are often served grilled or pan-fried. They are high in fat and sodium and should be consumed in moderation.

Wiener,european.description: Similar to a frankfurter, European wieners can be made with pork, beef, or a combination of meats. They are typically smoked and have a distinct flavor.

Wiener,low fat.description: A lower-fat alternative to traditional wieners, these are often made with leaner cuts of meat and have some of the fat content removed. Check the label for specific nutritional information.

Deli-meat,ham.description: A cured and processed meat product made from pork, ham can be high in sodium and saturated fat. Choose low-sodium and nitrate-free varieties when possible.

Deli-meat,corned beef.description: A salt-cured beef brisket, corned beef is often enjoyed as a deli meat or as part of traditional dishes. It is a good source of protein but is high in sodium.

Deli-meat,old fashioned smoked brisket.description: Brisket is a cut of beef known for its rich flavor. When smoked and cured, it becomes a flavorful deli meat. However, it is often high in fat and sodium.

Deli-meat,montreal smoked meat.description: A signature deli meat from Montreal, it's made by curing and smoking beef brisket with a blend of spices. It is flavorful but high in sodium and fat.

Deli-meat,summer sausage.description: A type of cured sausage typically made with pork and beef, summer sausage is a shelf-stable option often enjoyed as a snack or on sandwiches. It can be high in sodium and fat.

Deli-meat,mortadella.description: An Italian cured meat made with finely ground pork and often studded with pistachios or other flavorings. It is known for its distinctive pink color and slightly sweet flavor.

Deli-meat,pepperoni.description: A spicy and salty cured sausage made with pork and beef, pepperoni is a popular topping for pizzas and sandwiches. It is high in sodium and fat.

Pâté,country style cognac.description: A spread made with ground meat, often pork or chicken liver, and flavored with cognac. Pâté can be high in fat and cholesterol.

Pâté,country style herb.description: Similar to other pâtés, the herb variety incorporates a blend of fresh or dried herbs for added flavor. It can be a source of iron but is also high in fat.

Pâté,country style peppercorn.description: A flavorful variation of country-style pâté, seasoned with peppercorns for a slightly spicy kick. Enjoy in small amounts as part of a balanced meal.

Pâté.description: A French term for a paste or spread made with ground meat, poultry, fish, or vegetables. It can range in texture from smooth to chunky and is often served as an appetizer.

Energy drink.description: Beverages that typically contain high levels of caffeine, sugar, and other stimulants. While they can provide a temporary energy boost, they can also lead to crashes and are not recommended for regular consumption.

Plant-based beverage.description: A broad category of drinks made from plants, including soy milk, almond milk, oat milk, and coconut milk. They can be good alternatives for those avoiding dairy, but check for added sugars and choose unsweetened varieties whenever possible.

Crustaceans,crayfish.description: Crayfish, also known as crawfish, are freshwater crustaceans resembling small lobsters. They are low in fat and calories while being a good source of protein, omega-3 fatty acids, and selenium. Crayfish are often boiled and seasoned, commonly used in Cajun and Creole cuisine.

Crustaceans,shrimp.description: Shrimp are versatile shellfish low in calories and fat, and a good source of protein, iodine, and omega-3 fatty acids. They can be grilled, fried, sautéed, or boiled and are used in various cuisines worldwide, from salads and pasta dishes to curries and stir-fries.

Crustaceans,spiny lobster.description: Spiny lobsters are warm-water lobsters lacking large claws and possessing spiny antennae. Like other lobsters, they are a good source of protein and selenium, low in calories and saturated fat. Spiny lobster is often grilled or steamed and is a popular delicacy in many coastal regions.

Crustaceans,lobster.description: Lobster is a highly-prized crustacean known for its sweet and delicate flavor. It's rich in protein, omega-3 fatty acids, copper, and zinc, while being low in calories and saturated fat. Lobster is often steamed, boiled, or grilled and enjoyed as a luxurious meal.

Mollusks,abalone.description: Abalone is a type of marine snail prized for its flavorful meat. It's a good source of protein, iron, and magnesium. Due to overfishing, abalone is now considered a delicacy and is often grilled, sautéed, or eaten raw as sashimi.

Mollusks,clam.description: Clams are bivalve mollusks found in both saltwater and freshwater environments. They are a great source of protein, vitamin B12, iron, and selenium. Clams can be steamed, boiled, fried, or baked, and are used in various dishes, including chowders, pasta, and stews.

Mollusks,cuttlefish.description: Cuttlefish are marine cephalopods known for their mild, slightly sweet flavor. They're rich in protein, selenium, vitamin B12, and zinc. Cuttlefish can be grilled, fried, or sautéed and are frequently used in Mediterranean and Asian cuisines.

Mollusks,mussel.description: Mussels are bivalve mollusks often found clustered on rocks or ropes. They are an excellent source of protein, omega-3 fatty acids, vitamin B12, and manganese. Mussels can be steamed, smoked, or baked, often with white wine, garlic, and herbs.

Mollusks,octopus.description: Octopus is a cephalopod known for its unique texture and savory flavor. It is an excellent source of protein, omega-3 fatty acids, iron, and copper. Octopus can be grilled, braised, boiled, or eaten raw as sushi or sashimi, commonly used in Mediterranean and Asian cuisine.

Mollusks,oyster.description: Oysters are bivalve mollusks often consumed raw. They are known for their briny flavor and are rich in protein, zinc, iron, and vitamin B12. Oysters are often served on the half shell with lemon juice, but they can also be fried, grilled, or baked.

Mollusks,scallop.description: Scallops are bivalve mollusks known for their delicate, slightly sweet flavor and firm texture.
