They are a good source of protein, omega-3 fatty acids, magnesium, and potassium. Scallops can be seared, baked, grilled, or fried and are often served as an appetizer or in pasta dishes.

Mollusks,squid.description: Squid is a cephalopod with a chewy texture and mild, slightly sweet flavor. It's a good source of protein, selenium, riboflavin, and vitamin B12. Squid can be grilled, fried, sautéed, or stuffed and is a staple ingredient in many Mediterranean and Asian dishes.

Mollusks,whelk.description: Whelks are sea snails with a chewy texture and a slightly sweet, briny flavor. They are a good source of protein and iron. Whelks can be boiled, steamed, or fried and are often eaten as a snack or used in salads and seafood platters.

Mollusks,cockle.description: Cockles are small, edible saltwater clams. They are a good source of protein, iron, and vitamin B12. Cockles can be steamed, boiled, or added to soups and stews, offering a unique, slightly salty flavor.

Mollusks,conch.description: Conch is a tropical marine snail with firm, white meat. It's a good source of protein and iron. Conch is often used in fritters, chowders, and salads, particularly in Caribbean cuisine.

Mollusks,snail.description: Snails, particularly land snails, are a delicacy in some cultures. They are a good source of protein and iron. Snails are often cooked with garlic, butter, and herbs and served as a popular appetizer in French cuisine.

Beans.description: Beans are a versatile legume packed with nutrients. They are an excellent source of protein, fiber, folate, and various minerals. Beans can be cooked in numerous ways and are used in soups, stews, salads, and as a side dish.

Beans,lima,dry.description: Lima beans are legumes with a starchy texture and mild flavor. They are a good source of fiber, protein, and iron. Dry lima beans require soaking before cooking and are often used in soups, stews, and side dishes.

Beans,lima,dry,baby.description: Baby lima beans are smaller and more tender than regular lima beans. They have a delicate flavor and a creamy texture when cooked. Baby limas are a good source of fiber, protein, and iron, often used in salads and side dishes.

Peanuts,spanish.description: Spanish peanuts are smaller and have a higher oil content than other peanut varieties. They have a reddish-brown skin and are known for their intense flavor. Spanish peanuts are often roasted and salted for snacking or used in peanut butter.

Peanuts,valencia.description: Valencia peanuts are known for their sweet flavor and bright red skins. They have a lower oil content compared to other varieties and are primarily used for boiling or roasting. Valencia peanuts are often used in natural peanut butter due to their sweet flavor.

Peanuts,virginia.description: Virginia peanuts are the largest variety and are known for their large size and crunchy texture. They are often roasted and salted for snacking or used in gourmet peanut butter and peanut candies.

Peanut butter,chunk type.description: Chunk-type peanut butter contains coarsely ground peanuts, adding texture and crunch. It is a good source of protein, fiber, and healthy fats. Chunk peanut butter is a versatile spread for bread, crackers, or as a dip for fruits and vegetables.

Lamb,canadian.description: Canadian lamb is known for its tender texture and mild flavor.  It's raised without the use of hormones and is a good source of protein, iron, and vitamin B12. Canadian lamb is versatile and can be roasted, grilled, or braised.

Lamb,cubed.description: Cubed lamb is a convenient option for stews, curries, and kabobs. The smaller pieces cook faster and absorb flavors well. Lamb is a good source of protein, iron, and zinc.

Lamb,new zealand.description: New Zealand lamb is renowned for its delicate flavor and tender texture. The country's pasture-raised farming practices contribute to the quality of the meat. New Zealand lamb is a good source of protein, iron, and vitamin B12.

Veal,leg.description: Veal leg is a tender and lean cut of meat from young calves. It's a good source of protein, iron, and vitamin B12. Veal leg can be roasted whole, braised, or cut into steaks and pan-seared.

Veal,cutlets.description: Veal cutlets are thin, tender slices of meat from the leg or rib section. They cook quickly and are often pan-fried or sautéed. Veal is a good source of protein, iron, and vitamin B12.

Veal,loin.description: Veal loin is a tender and flavorful cut of meat. It can be roasted whole, cut into chops, or sliced into medallions. Veal loin is a good source of protein, iron, and vitamin B12.

Veal,rib.description: Veal rib is a flavorful and tender cut of meat. It can be roasted whole, cut into chops, or braised. Veal rib is a good source of protein, iron, and vitamin B12.

Veal,shoulder.description: Veal shoulder is a flavorful and economical cut of meat. It can be braised, roasted, or used for stews. Veal shoulder is a good source of protein, iron, and vitamin B12.

Veal,shoulder,shank.description: Veal shoulder shank is a tough but flavorful cut of meat. It's best cooked slowly using moist-heat methods like braising or stewing. Veal shank is a good source of collagen.

Veal,shoulder,blade.description: Veal shoulder blade is a flavorful and economical cut of meat. It can be braised, roasted, or used for stews. Veal shoulder blade is a good source of protein and iron.

Veal,sirloin.description: Veal sirloin is a lean and flavorful cut of meat. It can be grilled, pan-seared, or roasted. Veal sirloin is a good source of protein, iron, and vitamin B12.

Veal,cubed.description: Cubed veal is a versatile option for stews, curries, and kabobs. The smaller pieces cook quickly and absorb flavors well. Veal is a good source of protein, iron, and vitamin B12.

Veal,ground.description: Ground veal is a lean and flavorful ground meat option. It can be used in meatballs, meatloaf, or as a base for sauces. Ground veal is a good source of protein, iron, and vitamin B12.

Game meat,antelope.description: Antelope meat is a lean and flavorful game meat. It has a slightly sweet and gamey flavor. Antelope is a good source of protein, iron, and B vitamins.

Game meat,bear.description: Bear meat is a rich and flavorful game meat with a strong, gamey flavor.  It's important to cook bear meat thoroughly to eliminate potential parasites. Bear meat is a good source of protein and iron.

Game meat,beaver.description: Beaver meat is a dark and flavorful game meat with a rich, slightly sweet flavor. It was a traditional food source for many indigenous cultures. Beaver meat is a good source of protein and iron.

Game meat,beefalo.description: Beefalo meat is a cross between bison and domestic cattle. It has a leaner profile than beef and a slightly sweeter flavor. Beefalo is a good source of protein, iron, and B vitamins.

Game meat,bison.description: Bison meat is a lean and flavorful alternative to beef. It has a slightly sweeter flavor than beef. Bison is a good source of protein, iron, and B vitamins.

Game meat,boar.description: Boar meat is a rich, flavorful game meat with a more intense flavor than pork. It is important to cook boar meat thoroughly to eliminate potential parasites. Boar meat is a good source of protein and iron.

Game meat,water buffalo.description: Water buffalo meat is a leaner and slightly sweeter alternative to beef. It is a good source of protein, iron, and B vitamins.

Game meat,caribou.description: Caribou meat is a lean and flavorful game meat. It has a slightly gamey flavor and is a traditional food source for Arctic peoples. Caribou meat is a good source of protein and iron.

Game meat,deer.description: Deer meat, also known as venison, is a lean and flavorful game meat. It has a slightly gamey flavor. Deer meat is a good source of protein, iron, and B vitamins.

Game meat,elk.description: Elk meat is a lean and flavorful game meat with a slightly sweeter flavor than deer. It is a good source of protein, iron, and B vitamins.

Game meat,goat.description: Goat meat, often called chevon or mutton, is a lean and flavorful meat. It is a good source of protein, iron, and B vitamins.

Game meat,horse.description: Horse meat is consumed in some cultures but is less common than other meats. It has a slightly sweet flavor. Horse meat is a good source of protein and iron.

Game meat,moose.description: Moose meat is a lean and flavorful game meat with a slightly gamey flavor. It is a traditional food source for some indigenous cultures. Moose meat is a good source of protein and iron.

Game meat,muskrat.description: Muskrat meat was a traditional food source for some indigenous cultures. It has a strong, gamey flavor. Muskrat meat is a good source of protein.

Game meat,opossum.description: Opossum meat was a traditional food source for some indigenous cultures. It has a strong, musky flavor. Opossum meat is a good source of protein.

Game meat,rabbit,domesticated.description: Domesticated rabbit meat is a lean and mild-flavored meat. It is a good source of protein, B vitamins, and phosphorus.

Game meat,rabbit,wild.description: Wild rabbit meat has a slightly stronger, gamey flavor compared to domesticated rabbit. It is a good source of protein and iron.

Game meat,raccoon.description: Raccoon meat was a traditional food source for some indigenous cultures. It has a strong, gamey flavor. Raccoon meat is a good source of protein.

Game meat,squirrel.description: Squirrel meat was a traditional food source for some indigenous cultures. It has a delicate, slightly sweet flavor. Squirrel meat is a good source of protein.

Lamb,brain.description: Lamb brain is a rich source of iron and cholesterol, but it's also high in fat. It has a creamy texture and a delicate flavor when cooked properly. It's often used in traditional dishes.

Veal,brain.description: Veal brain, like lamb brain, is rich in cholesterol and iron, and requires careful cooking. It's known for its creamy texture and delicate flavor. It's less common in modern cuisine but features in some traditional European dishes.

Lamb,heart.description: Lamb heart is a lean and muscular organ meat that's rich in iron and B vitamins. It has a strong, slightly gamey flavor and a chewy texture. It's often braised, stewed, or grilled.

Veal,heart.description: Veal heart is a tender and mild-flavored organ meat. It's a good source of iron and B vitamins. Veal heart can be stuffed, braised, or pan-fried.

Lamb,kidney.description: Lamb kidney is a strong-flavored organ meat rich in iron and B vitamins. It needs to be soaked and cooked properly to reduce its strong taste. It's often used in traditional dishes.

Veal,kidney.description: Veal kidney is milder in flavor compared to lamb or beef kidneys. It is a good source of iron and B vitamins.  Veal kidneys can be sautéed, grilled, or added to stews.

Lamb,liver.description: Lamb liver is an incredibly nutrient-dense organ meat. It's an excellent source of iron, vitamin A, and B vitamins. Lamb liver has a strong, mineral flavor and can be pan-fried, grilled, or used in pâtés.

Veal,liver.description: Veal liver is known for its delicate flavor and smooth texture compared to beef or pork liver. It's an excellent source of iron, vitamin A, and B vitamins. Veal liver can be pan-fried, sautéed, or used in pâtés.

Lamb,lungs.description: Lamb lungs are not as common in modern cuisine but are found in traditional recipes.  They have a spongy texture and require careful cleaning and preparation. Lamb lungs are a source of protein.

Veal,lungs.description: Veal lungs, like lamb lungs, require specific preparation and are not as popular in contemporary cooking. They have a mild flavor and a spongy texture. Veal lungs can be used in stews or pâtés.

Lamb,mechanically separated.description: Mechanically separated lamb is made from the meat remaining on the bones after butchering. It has a higher fat content and is often used in processed meat products. It's important to consume mechanically separated meat in moderation due to its processing.

Lamb,pancreas.description: Lamb pancreas, also known as sweetbreads, is a delicacy with a creamy texture and delicate flavor. It's important to source sweetbreads from reputable suppliers and cook them properly. Sweetbreads are a source of protein.

Veal,pancreas.description: Veal pancreas, also known as sweetbreads, is considered a delicacy in many cuisines. It has a creamy texture and a delicate, sweet flavor. Veal sweetbreads are usually soaked, blanched, and then pan-fried, grilled, or braised.

Lamb,spleen.description: Lamb spleen, while not as popular as other organ meats, is a good source of iron and B vitamins. It has a strong flavor and requires careful preparation. Lamb spleen can be boiled, stewed, or grilled.

Cookie,peanut butter.description: Peanut butter cookies are a classic treat. They are made with peanut butter, sugar, eggs, and flour. Peanut butter cookies are a good source of protein and healthy fats from the peanut butter but can be high in sugar.

Cookie,sugar.description: Sugar cookies are a classic type of cookie that is often enjoyed during the holidays. They are made with butter, sugar, eggs, and flour. Sugar cookies are simple to make and can be decorated with icing and sprinkles. They are high in sugar and should be consumed in moderation.

Pie crust,standard type.description: Standard pie crusts are typically made with flour, fat (such as butter or shortening), and water.  They provide a flaky and buttery base for sweet or savory pies. Pie crusts can be high in fat, especially saturated fat, depending on the type of fat used.

Muffin,blueberry.description: Blueberry muffins are a popular breakfast or snack item. They are made with flour, sugar, eggs, milk, baking powder, and blueberries.  While a good source of carbohydrates and some vitamins from the blueberries, muffins can also be high in sugar and fat.

Muffin,wheat bran.description: Wheat bran muffins are often marketed as a healthier muffin option due to the added bran, which is a good source of fiber. However, it's important to check the sugar and fat content as some wheat bran muffins can still be high in these.

Veal,spleen.description: Veal spleen is a good source of iron and B vitamins. It has a milder flavor than beef or pork spleen. Veal spleen can be braised, stewed, or grilled.

Veal,thymus.description: Veal thymus, also known as sweetbread, is a delicate and flavorful organ meat. It has a creamy texture and is often pan-fried, grilled, or braised. Veal sweetbreads are a good source of protein and nutrients but are higher in cholesterol.

Lamb,tongue.description: Lamb tongue is a flavorful and gelatin-rich organ meat. It requires careful preparation, including boiling and peeling. Lamb tongue can be braised, stewed, or used in terrines.

Veal,tongue.description: Veal tongue is a delicacy known for its tender texture and delicate flavor. It's often braised or poached and served cold in slices. Veal tongue is a good source of protein, iron, and zinc.

Lamb,ground.description: Ground lamb is a flavorful and versatile ground meat. It can be used in burgers, meatballs, meatloaf, and a variety of ethnic dishes. Lamb is a good source of protein, iron, and vitamin B12.

Game meat,frog legs.description: Frog legs are known for their delicate, slightly fishy flavor and tender texture. They are a good source of protein and low in fat. Frog legs are often pan-fried, deep-fried, or grilled.

Game meat,seal.description: Seal meat is a traditional food source for Arctic indigenous peoples. It is a good source of protein, iron, and omega-3 fatty acids. Seal meat can be prepared in various ways, including roasted, boiled, and fried.

Game meat,walrus.description: Walrus meat is a traditional food source for Arctic indigenous peoples. It is a good source of protein, fat, and vitamin A. Walrus meat can be eaten raw, frozen, boiled, or fried.

Game meat,whale.description: Whale meat is a traditional food source for some cultures. It is a good source of protein and iron, but it can be high in mercury. Consumption of whale meat is regulated in many countries due to conservation concerns.

Veal,grain-fed.description: Grain-fed veal is raised on a diet that includes grain, which contributes to its lighter color and more delicate flavor.  It's a good source of protein, iron, and B vitamins. Grain-fed veal can be roasted, grilled, or pan-seared.

Game meat,bearded seal.description: Bearded seal meat is a traditional food source for Arctic indigenous peoples. It is a good source of protein, fat, and omega-3 fatty acids. Bearded seal meat can be eaten raw, frozen, boiled, or fried.

Game meat,beluga.description: Beluga meat is a traditional food source for Arctic indigenous peoples. It is a good source of protein, fat, and vitamin A. Beluga meat can be eaten raw, frozen, boiled, or fried.

Game meat,narwhal.description: Narwhal meat is a traditional food source for Arctic indigenous peoples. It is a good source of protein, fat, and vitamin A. Narwhal meat can be eaten raw, frozen, boiled, or fried.

Game meat,ringed seal.description: Ringed seal meat is a traditional food source for Arctic indigenous peoples. It is a good source of protein, fat, and omega-3 fatty acids. Ringed seal meat can be eaten raw, frozen, boiled, or fried.

Game meat,muskox.description: Muskox meat is a lean and flavorful game meat. It has a slightly sweet and gamey flavor. Muskox is a good source of protein, iron, and B vitamins.

Game meat,polar bear.description: Consumption of polar bear meat is restricted in many areas due to conservation concerns. It's important to note that polar bear liver is highly toxic to humans due to its high concentration of vitamin A.

Game meat,agutuk.description: Agutuk is a traditional Eskimo dish made from rendered animal fat, often from whales, seals, or caribou. It's a high-energy food source, rich in calories and fat, and is typically eaten with berries or other foods.

Game meat,horned owl.description: Horned owl meat is not commonly consumed. Owls are birds of prey, and their meat is not typically considered palatable.  In most places, hunting owls is illegal.

Game meat,bowhead.description: Bowhead whale meat is a traditional food source for Arctic indigenous peoples. It is a good source of protein, fat, and vitamin A. Bowhead whale meat can be eaten raw, frozen, boiled, or fried. Consumption is regulated.

Game meat,sea lion.description: Sea lion meat is a traditional food source for some coastal indigenous peoples. It is a good source of protein and iron, but it can have a strong flavor. Sea lion populations are protected in many areas.

Grains,wheat germ.description: Wheat germ is the nutrient-rich embryo of the wheat kernel. It's packed with fiber, protein, healthy fats, vitamins, and minerals. Wheat germ can be added to smoothies, yogurt, or used as a topping for cereal or salads.

Cereal,cream of rice.description: Cream of rice is a type of rice porridge made from finely milled white rice. It's often given to infants and young children as a easily digestible breakfast option. While a good source of energy, cream of rice is low in fiber and nutrients compared to whole grains.

Grains,corn grits.description: Corn grits are a breakfast staple in the Southern United States. They are made from ground dried corn and are a good source of carbohydrates and some B vitamins. Grits are often cooked with water or milk and served with butter, cheese, or shrimp.

Bread stuffing,cornbread.description: Cornbread stuffing is a popular side dish, especially during Thanksgiving. It is made with crumbled cornbread, broth, vegetables, and herbs. Cornbread stuffing is flavorful and moist, but it can be high in sodium and fat depending on the recipe.

Cake mix,carrot.description: Carrot cake mix is a convenient way to make carrot cake.  It typically contains sugar, flour, spices, and dehydrated carrots. While a tasty treat, it's important to consume cake mixes in moderation due to their high sugar and processed ingredient content.

Cake mix,chocolate.description: Chocolate cake mix is a popular baking ingredient used to make chocolate cakes and cupcakes. It usually contains sugar, flour, cocoa powder, and leavening agents. While convenient, chocolate cake mixes are high in sugar and should be consumed in moderation.

Coffee cake mix,cinnamon.description: Cinnamon coffee cake mix is a baking mix used to make cinnamon coffee cakes. It generally contains sugar, flour, cinnamon, and leavening agents. While convenient, cinnamon coffee cake mixes are often high in sugar and should be enjoyed occasionally.

Cake mix,german chocolate.description: German chocolate cake mix is used to make German chocolate cake, typically layered with a coconut-pecan frosting.  It usually includes sugar, flour, cocoa powder, and sometimes coconut flakes.  These mixes are often high in sugar and should be consumed in moderation.

Cake mix,gingerbread.description: Gingerbread cake mix is a seasonal baking mix used to make gingerbread cakes. It usually contains sugar, flour, ginger, cinnamon, and other spices.  While a festive treat, gingerbread cake mixes are generally high in sugar and should be enjoyed occasionally.

Cake mix,marble.description: Marble cake mix is used to make marble cake, which gets its appearance from swirling light and dark batter. It usually contains sugar, flour, cocoa powder, and vanilla extract.  It's important to note that marble cake mixes are typically high in sugar and should be consumed in moderation.

Cake,white.description: White cake is a classic cake known for its fluffy texture and vanilla flavor. It is typically made with butter, sugar, eggs, flour, and vanilla extract. While delicious, white cake is a dessert and should be consumed in moderation due to its sugar and calorie content.

Cake,yellow.description: Yellow cake gets its golden color from the addition of egg yolks. It is a classic cake known for its moist and tender crumb and buttery flavor.  It's essential to consume yellow cake in moderation as it is high in sugar and calories.

Cookie,brownie.description: Brownies are chewy, chocolatey treats that are popular worldwide. They are usually made with butter, sugar, chocolate, eggs, and flour. Brownies are a delicious dessert but are high in calories and sugar.

Cookie,chocolate chip.description: Chocolate chip cookies are a classic treat enjoyed by many. They are made with butter, sugar, eggs, flour, and chocolate chips. While delicious, chocolate chip cookies are high in calories and sugar and should be consumed in moderation.

Cookie,oatmeal.description: Oatmeal cookies are a type of cookie that contains rolled oats. They are often considered to be a healthier cookie option because oats are a good source of fiber. However, oatmeal cookies can still be high in sugar and fat depending on the recipe.

Grains,wheat,kamut khorasan.description: Kamut is a trademarked name for an ancient grain related to wheat. It has a nutty flavor and a higher protein content than modern wheat. Kamut is a good source of fiber, selenium, and zinc.

Pasta,corn.description: Corn pasta is a gluten-free alternative to wheat pasta. It's made from corn flour and has a slightly sweet flavor. Corn pasta is a good source of carbohydrates.

Pasta,egg noodles.description: Egg noodles are made with flour and eggs, giving them a richer flavor and a firmer texture. They are a good source of carbohydrates and protein.

Pasta,unenriched.description: Unenriched pasta is made with durum wheat flour that hasn't been fortified with additional nutrients. It's a good source of carbohydrates but lower in certain vitamins and minerals compared to enriched pasta.

Pasta,macaroni.description: Macaroni is a type of pasta shaped like narrow, curved elbows. It's a versatile pasta that can be used in macaroni and cheese, salads, and soups.

Pasta,chinese noodles.description: Chinese noodles come in various shapes, sizes, and flavors. They are often made with wheat flour, rice flour, or mung bean starch. Chinese noodles are a staple in many Asian cuisines.

Pasta,japanese noodles.description: Japanese noodles also come in a wide variety, including ramen, udon, and soba. They are often used in soups, stir-fries, and salads.

Pasta,spaghetti.description: Spaghetti is a long, thin type of pasta. It is a versatile pasta that can be paired with various sauces, meats, and vegetables.

Pasta,macaroni,protein-fortified.description: Protein-fortified macaroni is enriched with additional protein, making it a more filling and nutritious pasta option. It's often marketed to athletes and those looking to increase their protein intake.

Pasta,macaroni (spirals),vegetable.description: Vegetable-based macaroni spirals often incorporate vegetable purees or powders, adding flavor, color, and some additional nutrients to the pasta.

Pasta,egg noodles,spinach.description: Spinach egg noodles are made with spinach puree or powder, which gives them a green color and a subtle spinach flavor. They are a good source of carbohydrates, protein, and some vitamins and minerals.

Pasta,spaghetti,spinach.description: Spinach spaghetti, similar to spinach egg noodles, includes spinach for added color, flavor, and nutrients. It's a good source of carbohydrates and contains some iron and vitamin A from the spinach.

Pasta,spaghetti,protein-fortified.description: Protein-fortified spaghetti is enriched with additional protein, similar to protein-fortified macaroni. It offers a higher protein content compared to regular spaghetti.

Pasta,fresh-refrigerated.description: Fresh-refrigerated pasta is typically made with eggs and flour and has a softer texture than dried pasta. It cooks quickly and has a more delicate flavor.

Beef,loin,top sirloin roast.description: A flavorful and relatively lean roast from the sirloin. Top sirloin roast is best cooked using moist heat methods like braising or roasting to ensure tenderness.

Pâtâté,country style peppercorn.description: This pâté gets a kick from the addition of peppercorns, adding a spicy flavor to the rich spread. It's typically high in fat and should be consumed in moderation.

Pasta,rice noodles.description: A thin form of pasta made from rice flour. They're gluten-free and commonly used in Asian cuisine, particularly in soups, stir-fries, and spring rolls.

Pasta,vermicelli.description: A very thin, long pasta, often used in Italian and Asian cuisines.  It cooks quickly and can be used in soups, salads, or as a main course with various sauces.

Rosemary.description: A fragrant evergreen herb with needle-like leaves. Its strong, slightly piney flavor is often used to season roasted meats, vegetables, and soups. It's also a source of antioxidants.

Peppermint.description: A hybrid mint plant known for its refreshing flavor and aroma. It's often consumed in teas, candies, and desserts, and its oil is used in various products for its potential digestive benefits.

Plant-based beverage,rice.description: A dairy-free milk alternative made from milled rice and water. It's often fortified with vitamins and minerals. It has a slightly sweet flavor and is a good option for those with nut or soy allergies.

Cake,pound.description: A dense, rich cake traditionally made with equal parts butter, sugar, eggs, and flour.  It's often flavored with vanilla or lemon and is a classic dessert for various occasions.

Candies.description: Sweet treats available in a wide variety of flavors, textures, and forms. While enjoyable, they should be consumed in moderation as part of a balanced diet.

Candies,bars.description: Chocolate or candy-coated bars often containing nuts, caramel, or other fillings. They are a popular snack or treat but tend to be high in sugar and calories.

Candies,butterscotch.description: A type of candy made with brown sugar and butter. It has a rich, caramel-like flavor and is often found in candies, chips, and sauces.

Dessert,frozen,pudding pop.description: Frozen treats made from milk, sugar, and flavorings. They are a fun and refreshing dessert, especially during warmer months.

Candies,caramel.description: A smooth, chewy confection made by heating sugar. It's often used as a topping or filling for various desserts and candies.

Sweets,baking chocolate.description: Unsweetened chocolate used in baking. It has a strong, intense chocolate flavor and is often combined with sugar to create desserts.

Candies,fondant.description: A thick, pliable sugar paste used for decorating cakes and pastries.  It can also be formed into sweets.

Dessert,frozen,ice cream,light.description: A lower-fat version of ice cream, often made with milk instead of cream. It's a slightly healthier alternative to regular ice cream.

Dessert,frozen,ice cream.description: A frozen dessert made from dairy products, sweeteners, and flavorings. It's a popular treat, but high in calories and sugar, so should be enjoyed in moderation.

Candies,peppermint.description: Candies flavored with peppermint oil, known for their refreshing taste and potential to aid digestion.  They're often enjoyed after meals.

Dessert,frozen,sherbet.description: A frozen dessert made with fruit juice, sugar, and a small amount of dairy. It's lighter than ice cream and typically lower in fat.

Candies,fudge.description: A soft, dense candy made by cooking sugar, butter, and milk or cream. It often includes chocolate or nuts and is a rich treat.

Candies,goobers.description: Chocolate-covered peanut butter candies. They're a classic combination of sweet and salty flavors, but should be consumed in moderation due to sugar and fat content.

Candies,gumdrops.description: Chewy, gelatin-based candies often coated in sugar.  They come in a variety of colors and flavors.

Candies,hard.description: Sugar-based candies that are meant to be sucked on until they dissolve. While enjoyable, they can contribute to tooth decay if consumed frequently.

Candies,jellybeans.description: Small, bean-shaped candies with a chewy texture and a wide range of flavors.  They are a popular treat around Easter.

Candies,licorice.description: A confectionery flavored with extract from the licorice root. It has a distinctive, slightly sweet and anise-like flavor.  It comes in various forms.

Sweets,syrup,table blend.description: A blend of corn syrup and maple syrup often used as a topping for pancakes, waffles, and other breakfast foods. It typically has a mild maple flavor.

Candies,marshmallow.description: A spongy confection made from sugar, gelatin, and often corn syrup.  They can be eaten as is, used in desserts, or toasted over a fire.

Candies,milk chocolate.description: A sweeter type of chocolate made with cocoa butter, milk solids, and sugar. It's often used in candies and desserts.

Dessert,pudding,banana.description: A creamy dessert made with bananas, milk or cream, sugar, and often vanilla. It can be served chilled or warm.

Candies,Golden Almond.description: Chocolate-covered roasted almonds.  They offer a sweet and crunchy treat.

Candies,M&M's.description: Button-shaped candies with a hard candy shell surrounding milk chocolate. They come in various colors and special editions are released for holidays.

Candies,peanut.description: Roasted peanuts often coated in sugar or chocolate. They offer a source of protein and healthy fats but should be consumed in moderation due to calorie content.

Candies,peanut brittle.description: A brittle candy made from sugar, corn syrup, and peanuts.  It has a distinctive crunchy texture.

Candies,reese's.description: Peanut butter and chocolate candies.  They combine sweet and salty flavors and are high in calories and fat.

Candies,rolo.description: Chocolate candies with a caramel center. They offer a combination of flavors and textures.

Candies,after eight.description: Square-shaped mint chocolates typically enjoyed after dinner. They offer a refreshing end to a meal.

Candies,sesame crunch.description: Candies made with sesame seeds and sugar, often held together by honey or syrup.  They have a nutty flavor and crunchy texture.

Candies,snickers.description: Chocolate bars with peanuts, caramel, and nougat.  They are high in calories and fat but offer a combination of flavors and textures.

Candies,starburst.description: Chewy, square-shaped fruit-flavored candies.  They come in a variety of flavors and are individually wrapped.

Candies,twix.description: Caramel and chocolate-covered biscuit bars.  They combine sweet and crunchy textures.

Candies,chewing gum.description: Not intended to be swallowed, chewing gum is designed to be chewed for its flavor or to freshen breath.

Candies,dark chocolate.description: A type of chocolate that contains a higher percentage of cocoa solids. It has a more intense, slightly bitter chocolate flavor and is a source of antioxidants.

Sweets,cocoa,powder.description: The powder made from roasted and ground cacao beans. It's used to make chocolate and chocolate-flavored foods and beverages.

Dessert,egg custard.description: A creamy dessert made with eggs, milk or cream, and sugar. It can be flavored with vanilla, nutmeg, or other spices.

Dessert,gelatin.description: A wobbly dessert made with flavored gelatin powder and water.  It's low in calories and fat but offers minimal nutritional value.

Dessert,pudding,chocolate.description: A sweet, creamy dessert made from milk or cream, sugar, and cocoa powder.  It can be served warm or chilled.

Dessert,flan.description: A custard dessert with a layer of caramel on top. It is popular in many Latin American countries.

Dessert,pudding,coconut.description: A creamy pudding made with coconut milk, sugar, and often cornstarch or tapioca starch. It has a rich, coconut flavor and can be served warm or chilled.

Dessert,pudding,rice.description: A classic comfort dessert made with rice, milk, sugar, and often vanilla or cinnamon.  It can be enjoyed warm or cold.

Dessert,pudding,tapioca.description: A pudding made with tapioca pearls, milk or cream, sugar, and flavorings.  It has a unique chewy texture.

Dessert,pudding,vanilla.description: A classic pudding flavor, often made with milk or cream, sugar, cornstarch, and vanilla extract.  It's a versatile dessert.

Dessert,pudding,lemon.description: A refreshing and tart pudding often made with lemon juice, zest, sugar, eggs, and butter.  It's a delicious and light dessert.

Dessert,rennin,chocolate.description: A type of milk-based dessert thickened with rennet and often flavored with chocolate.  It has a custard-like texture.

Dessert,rennin,vanilla.description: A dessert similar in texture to yogurt, flavored with vanilla and thickened with rennet.

Dessert,rennin tablets.description: Tablets containing rennet, an enzyme used to coagulate milk and make cheese. They are also used in some desserts to create a custard-like texture.

Icing.description: A sweet glaze made from sugar and other ingredients, used to coat or decorate cakes, pastries, and other desserts. It adds sweetness and visual appeal.

Dessert,frozen,fruit and juice bar.description: Frozen treats made with fruit juice or purée, and sometimes chunks of fruit. They're a refreshing and often lower-calorie alternative to ice cream.

Dessert,frozen,ices.description: Frozen desserts similar to sorbet, made with fruit juice, sugar, and water. They have a lighter, more granular texture than ice cream.

Dessert,frozen,ice pop.description: Frozen treats made with fruit juice, yogurt, or other flavored liquids. They're a refreshing treat, especially on hot days.

Dessert,frozen yogourt.description: A frozen dessert made with yogurt, giving it a tangier flavor than ice cream. It often contains probiotics and may be lower in fat than traditional ice cream.

Sweets,fruit butters.description: Concentrated fruit spreads made by cooking fruit with sugar. They're a good source of fruit flavor and can be used on toast, pancakes, or in baking.

Sweets,honey.description: A natural sweetener produced by honeybees from the nectar of flowers. It's sweeter than sugar and contains antioxidants.

Sweets,jams and preserves.description: Fruit spreads made from crushed or chopped fruits and sugar. Jams have a smoother consistency while preserves contain chunks of fruit.

Sweets,jellies.description: Fruit spreads made with fruit juice and sugar. They have a firm, gelatinous texture and are typically clear.

Sweets,marmalade.description: A citrus fruit preserve made with citrus juice, peel, and sugar. It typically has a slightly bitter and sweet flavor.

Sweets,molasses.description: A thick syrup produced during sugar refining. It has a rich, bittersweet flavor and is used in baking and cooking.

Sweets,pectin.description: A natural gelling agent derived from fruits. It's used to thicken jams, jellies, and other preserves.

Sweets,pie fillings.description: Prepared fillings used for pies, often fruit-based and sweetened.  They provide convenience in baking.

Sweets,sugar,brown.description: Sugar with molasses added, giving it a brown color and slightly caramel-like flavor. It's often used in baking.

Sweets,sugars,granulated.description: Fine, white sugar commonly used in baking and cooking.  It's the most versatile type of sugar.

Sweets,sugars,icing.description: A superfine sugar that dissolves easily, often used in frostings and icings for a smooth texture.

Sweets,sugars,maple.description: A natural sweetener made from the sap of maple trees. It has a distinctive flavor and is a good source of antioxidants.

Sweets,syrups,chocolate.description: A sweet syrup with a chocolate flavor, often used as a topping for ice cream, pancakes, or desserts.

Sweets,syrups,corn.description: A thick, sweet syrup made from cornstarch.  It is used in a variety of food products.

Sweets,syrups,malt.description: A sweet syrup made from germinated barley.  It has a distinctive flavor and is used in beverages and confections.

Sweets,syrups,maple.description: A natural sweetener made from the sap of maple trees.  It has a distinctive flavor and contains antioxidants.

Sweets,syrups,sorghum.description: A syrup made from the juice of sorghum cane.  It has a mild, slightly sweet flavor.

Sweets,syrups,table blends.description: Mixtures of different syrups, such as corn syrup and maple syrup, often used as a topping for pancakes, waffles, and other breakfast foods.

Sweets,topping.description: A sweet sauce, cream, or other ingredient added to desserts for added flavor and texture.  Examples include whipped cream, chocolate sauce, and fruit compotes.

Candies,skittles.description: Fruit-flavored candies with a hard candy shell.  They're known for their variety of colors and the slogan "Taste the Rainbow."

Icing,glaze.description: A thin, glossy icing made from sugar and liquid, used to coat cakes, pastries, and cookies. It adds a touch of sweetness and shine.

Snacks,banana chips.description: Dried slices of banana, often deep-fried or dehydrated. They're a convenient snack but can be high in fat and calories depending on preparation.

Snacks,corn nuts.description: Roasted kernels of corn, often seasoned with salt.  They provide a crunchy and savory snack.

Snacks,crisped rice bar.description: Snack bars made from crisped rice and often held together by sugar or syrup.  They can be a source of carbohydrates but often lack significant nutritional value.

Meat sticks,beef.description: Portable snacks made from seasoned ground beef. They can be a source of protein but are often high in sodium and fat.

Snacks,pork skins.description: Crispy snacks made from fried or roasted pig skin.  They are high in protein and fat but low in carbohydrates.

Snacks,potato chips,dried potatoes.description: A variation of potato chips made from dehydrated potatoes rather than fried slices.  They tend to have a crispier texture.

Snacks,rice cakes.description: Thin, round cakes made from puffed rice. They're low in calories and fat but are also low in other nutrients. They can be topped with various spreads.

Snacks,potato sticks.description: Thin, stick-shaped potato snacks, often flavored.  They are typically deep-fried and can be high in fat and sodium.

Snacks,sesame sticks.description: Crispy snacks made from sesame seeds and often flavored with soy sauce or other seasonings.  They offer a nutty flavor and crunchy texture.

Snacks,corn cakes.description: Round, flat snacks made from cornmeal or corn flour. They can be eaten plain or topped with various ingredients.

Snacks,potato chips,cheese.description: Potato chips with a cheese flavor, often achieved through flavoring powders. They are a popular snack but high in sodium and fat.

Snacks,tortilla chips,nacho.description: Tortilla chips specifically flavored for nachos, often with a cheesy or spicy flavor.  They're served with melted cheese and other toppings.

Snacks,taro chips.description: Chips made from taro root, often fried or baked.  They offer a slightly sweet and nutty flavor.

Sweets,chocolate,semisweet.description: A type of chocolate that falls between bittersweet and milk chocolate in terms of sweetness. It's often used in baking and desserts.

Sweets,jams and preserves,apricot.description: Fruit spreads made from apricots and sugar. They can be used on toast, scones, or as a filling for pastries.

Snacks,popcorn,air-popped.description: A whole-grain snack made by heating popcorn kernels without oil.  It's a low-calorie, high-fiber snack option.

Snacks,popcorn,oil-popped.description: Popcorn made by heating kernels in oil.  While tasty, it is higher in calories and fat than air-popped popcorn.

Beverage,bean.description: Non-alcoholic drinks made from beans such as soybeans. Examples include soy milk and other plant-based milk alternatives.

Wiener.description: A type of sausage often made from pork or beef. It is commonly served in a bun as a hot dog.

Milk,buttermilk.description: A tangy, fermented milk product traditionally made from the liquid left over after churning butter.  It's used in baking to add flavor and tenderness.

Candies,milky way.description: Chocolate-covered bars with a caramel and nougat filling.  They're known for their creamy texture and sweet flavor.

Indian,papad.description: Thin, crispy flatbreads made from lentil flour, chickpea flour, or rice flour.  They are a popular snack or accompaniment to Indian meals.

Salad dressing,coleslaw.description: A creamy dressing typically made with mayonnaise, vinegar, sugar, and seasonings.  It is commonly used to dress coleslaw.

Vegetable oil,flaxseed.description: Oil extracted from flaxseeds, rich in omega-3 fatty acids.  It has a nutty flavor and can be used in salad dressings or as a supplement.

Salad dressing,caesar.description: A creamy dressing made with Parmesan cheese, lemon juice, olive oil, egg yolks, and seasonings.  It is used in Caesar salads.

Salad dressing,green goddess.description: A mayonnaise-based dressing that includes herbs like parsley, chives, and tarragon.  It often has a vibrant green color.

Salad dressing,buttermilk.description: A tangy and creamy salad dressing made with buttermilk, mayonnaise, herbs, and spices.  It pairs well with salads, vegetables, and as a dipping sauce.

Sweets,syrups,dietetic.description: Sugar-free syrups often made with artificial sweeteners. They offer a lower-calorie alternative to traditional syrups.

Candies,nougat.description: A chewy confection typically made with sugar, honey, egg whites, and nuts. It's often found in candy bars and chocolate assortments.

Candies,gum drops.description: Chewy, gelatin-based candies often coated in sugar.  They come in a variety of colors and flavors.

Candies,chocolate covered.description: A wide variety of candies that are coated in chocolate. Common examples include chocolate-covered pretzels, raisins, nuts, and fruit.

Snacks,pretzels.description: Baked bread snacks, typically knot-shaped and sprinkled with salt.  They're a good source of carbohydrates and offer a satisfying crunch.

Beans,chili.description: Dried beans, often kidney beans, that are a key ingredient in chili con carne. They're a good source of protein, fiber, and various nutrients.

Vermicelli.description: A very thin, long pasta, often used in Italian and Asian cuisines. It cooks quickly and can be used in soups, salads, or as a main course with various sauces.

Meatless,chicken.description: Plant-based alternatives to chicken, often made from soy, seitan, or other protein sources.  They mimic the taste and texture of chicken.

Meatless,fish sticks.description: Plant-based alternatives to fish sticks, typically breaded and shaped to resemble fish. They may be made from soy, mushrooms, or other ingredients.

Meatless,luncheon slices.description: Plant-based alternatives to deli meat slices, often made from soy, seitan, or vegetables.  They're used in sandwiches and wraps.

Meatless,meatballs.description: Plant-based alternatives to meatballs, made from ingredients like lentils, beans, or vegetables.  They're a source of plant-based protein.

Vegetarian fillets.description: Plant-based alternatives designed to resemble fish fillets, often made from soy, tofu, or konjac. They provide a vegetarian option for fish dishes.

Meatless,sandwich spread.description: Plant-based spreads designed to replace meat-based sandwich fillings. They can be made from ingredients like chickpeas, vegetables, or nuts.

Vegetarian stew.description: Hearty stews made with vegetables, beans, and often grains or pasta, but without meat.  They're a nutritious and filling meal option.

Vegetarian meat loaf.description: A plant-based alternative to meatloaf, typically made with lentils, beans, vegetables, and grains. It's a source of protein and fiber.

Radish,hawaiian style.description: A variety of radish with a milder flavor than traditional radishes. They're often eaten raw in salads or as a crunchy snack.

Cabbage,japanese style.description: Varieties of cabbage commonly used in Japanese cuisine, such as napa cabbage and bok choy. They have a milder flavor than regular cabbage.

Cabbage,mustard.description: Leafy greens with a slightly peppery flavor, often used in Asian cuisine. They're a good source of vitamins and minerals.

Eggplant,pickled.description: Eggplant preserved in a vinegar-based brine, often with spices. It has a tangy, savory flavor and can be used as a condiment or side dish.

Alcohol,wine,cooking.description: Wine specifically bottled for cooking. It has a higher alcohol content than table wine and is used to enhance the flavor of sauces and dishes.

Alcohol,table wine,light.description: Wines with a lower alcohol content than standard table wines. They offer a lighter option for consumption.

Instant breakfast,chocolate.description: Powdered breakfast mixes that are chocolate-flavored and often fortified with vitamins and minerals.  They are mixed with milk or water.

Meatless,bacon bits.description: Soy-based or mushroom-based alternatives designed to mimic the flavor and texture of bacon bits.  They add a smoky, savory flavor to dishes.

Butter replacement.description: Products formulated to replace butter in cooking and baking, often made from vegetable oils or a blend of oils and other ingredients. They may be lower in fat or calories than butter.

Salad dressing,buttermilk,light.description: A lower-fat version of buttermilk salad dressing, often made with reduced-fat mayonnaise or yogurt. It provides a tangy and creamy dressing option with fewer calories.

Tomato sauce.description: A cooked sauce made primarily from tomatoes, often seasoned with herbs and spices.  It's a versatile ingredient used in many dishes, such as pasta sauces and pizzas.

Whipped cream substitute.description: Plant-based alternatives to whipped cream, often made from coconut cream, soy milk, or other ingredients. They offer a dairy-free option for topping desserts.

Dessert,frozen,ice cream,sundae.description: Ice cream topped with sauces, nuts, whipped cream, and a cherry. They're a classic ice cream treat but tend to be high in calories and sugar.

Cheese,cream,light.description: A lower-fat version of cream cheese, often made with reduced-fat milk. It provides a tangy flavor with fewer calories and fat.

Egg,scrambled.description: Eggs that are beaten together and cooked in a pan with butter or oil. They're a versatile breakfast staple and good source of protein.

Dove.description: A brand of chocolate known for its smooth and creamy texture. They offer a variety of chocolate bars and candies.

Soybean,curd cheese.description: A cheese-like product made from curdled soy milk, also known as tofu. It's a good source of protein and often used in Asian cuisine.

Potatoes,canned.description: Potatoes that have been cooked and canned for convenience. They're often used in soups, stews, or as a side dish.

Vegetables,canned.description: Various vegetables that have been cooked and canned for preservation. While convenient, they may be lower in nutrients than fresh or frozen vegetables.

Snacks,tortilla chips.description: Crispy snacks made from corn tortillas, often seasoned with salt or other flavors.  They're a popular snack food and can be served with dips.

Juice,tomato and vegetable.description: A blend of tomato juice and other vegetable juices. It can be a good source of vitamins and minerals.

Chocolate flavour drink.description: Beverages that are chocolate-flavored but may not contain actual chocolate. They are often made with cocoa powder, sugar, and flavorings.

Cheese,processed product.description: Cheese products made from natural cheese that has been blended with emulsifiers and other ingredients for a smoother texture. They tend to be higher in sodium and processed ingredients.

Cranberry juice.description: Juice made from cranberries, often sweetened. It's known for its tart flavor and potential health benefits, particularly for urinary tract health.

Turnip greens,canned.description: Turnip greens that have been cooked and canned.  They're a good source of vitamins and minerals but may be higher in sodium than fresh or frozen options.

Yeast extract spread.description: Savory spreads made from yeast extract, such as Vegemite or Marmite. They are rich in B vitamins.

Snacks,corn-based,extruded,chips.description: Chips made from cornmeal that has been extruded and shaped, often resulting in a puffed or crunchy texture. They can be seasoned with various flavors.

Yogourt,tofu.description: A dairy-free yogurt alternative made from soy milk that has been fermented with yogurt cultures.  It offers a similar taste and texture to traditional yogurt.

Alcohol,rice.description: Alcoholic beverages made from fermented rice, such as sake. They have a distinctive flavor profile.

Jellyfish.description: A marine animal that is sometimes consumed as a delicacy.  It has a crunchy texture and a slightly salty flavor.

Dessert,frozen,pop.description: Frozen treats made with fruit juice, yogurt, or other flavored liquids. They're a refreshing treat, especially on hot days.

Snacks,popcorn.description: A whole-grain snack made by heating popcorn kernels. It's a low-calorie snack when air-popped and can be seasoned with various flavors.

Breakfast bar.description: Convenient snack bars often marketed as a breakfast replacement.  They vary widely in nutritional content and ingredients.

Cheese food.description: Processed cheese products made from natural cheese that has been blended with emulsifiers, whey, and other ingredients. They tend to have a smoother texture than natural cheese.

Celery flakes.description: Dried celery that has been crushed into flakes.  They are used as a seasoning to add a savory celery flavor to dishes.

Sweets,pie fillings,blueberry.description: Prepared fillings made from blueberries, sugar, and thickeners, used for pies and other desserts.  They provide a convenient way to add blueberry flavor.

Cocktail mix.description: Mixes that contain flavorings and sweeteners, designed to be combined with alcohol to create cocktails.  They vary widely in sugar content.

Dessert,pudding.description: A creamy dessert made with milk or cream, sugar, and a thickening agent. It can be flavored with various ingredients such as chocolate, vanilla, or fruit.

Emu,ground.description: Ground meat from the emu, a flightless bird native to Australia.  It's a lean and high-protein red meat option.

Emu,fan fillet.description: A specific cut of emu meat known for its tenderness.  It can be grilled, pan-fried, or roasted.

Emu,flat fillet.description: A lean cut of emu meat that can be grilled, pan-fried, or roasted. It has a rich flavor similar to beef.

Emu,full rump.description: A larger cut of emu meat that includes the rump and leg. It's suitable for roasting or braising.

Emu,inside drum.description: A lean cut of meat from the emu's leg. It's best cooked slowly with moist heat methods.

Emu,outside drum.description: A flavorful cut of emu meat from the leg. It's best cooked slowly with moist heat methods.

Emu,oyster.description: A small, tender cut of meat from the emu's back.  It's best cooked quickly over high heat.

Emu,top loin.description: A tender and flavorful cut of emu meat.  It can be grilled, pan-fried, or roasted.

Ostrich,ground.description: Ground meat from the ostrich, the largest bird species. It is a lean and high-protein red meat option.

Ostrich,inside leg.description: A lean cut of ostrich meat from the leg.  It's best cooked slowly with moist heat methods.

Ostrich,inside strip.description: A tender cut of ostrich meat from the back. It's best cooked quickly over high heat.

Ostrich,outside leg.description: A flavorful cut of ostrich meat from the leg. It's best cooked slowly with moist heat methods.

Ostrich,outside strip.description: A lean and tender cut of ostrich meat from the back.  It can be grilled, pan-fried, or roasted.

Ostrich,oyster.description: A small, tender cut of ostrich meat from the back. It's best cooked quickly over high heat.

Ostrich,round.description: A lean cut of ostrich meat that's best suited for slow cooking methods like braising or stewing.

Ostrich,tenderloin.description: The most tender cut of ostrich meat, located along the backbone.  It's best cooked quickly over high heat.

Ostrich,tip trimmed.description: Ostrich meat that has had the tip removed, often for presentation purposes. Cooking methods vary depending on the specific cut.

Ostrich,top loin.description: A tender and flavorful cut of ostrich meat.  It can be grilled, pan-fried, or roasted.

Liverwurst spread.description: A spreadable sausage made with pork liver, often seasoned with spices and herbs.  It has a distinctive, savory flavor.

Sausage,polish.description: A type of sausage often made with pork and seasoned with garlic, pepper, and marjoram. It's often grilled or pan-fried.

Meat sticks.description: Portable snacks made from seasoned ground meat, often dried or smoked. They can be a source of protein but are often high in sodium and fat.

Sausage,bratwurst.description: A type of German sausage traditionally made from pork and veal, often seasoned with ginger, nutmeg, and coriander.  It is often grilled or pan-fried.

Sausage,italian.description: A flavorful sausage often made with pork, beef, or a combination, seasoned with fennel or anise.  It's used in various Italian dishes.

Sausage,italian,turkey.description: A lower-fat alternative to traditional Italian sausage, made with ground turkey instead of pork or beef. It often includes similar seasonings like fennel or anise.

Sausage,smoked,turkey.description: Smoked sausage made with ground turkey. It's a lower-fat alternative to pork or beef sausage and offers a smoky flavor.

Deli-meat,beerwurst.description: A type of German sausage often flavored with beer.  It can be served cold or hot.

Deli-meat,bologna.description: A type of sausage made from finely ground meat and seasonings.  It's often served cold in sandwiches.

Deli-meat,honey ham.description: Ham that has been cured or cooked with honey, giving it a slightly sweet flavor. It's often served cold in sandwiches.
